title: Social Media & Podcast Production Intern
description:
About the Role



Seller Fuel (dba Toy Launch) is hiring a Social Media & Podcast Production Intern to support our content ecosystem across podcasts, social media, and brand channels.



This is a true entry-level internship designed for someone who wants to learn, build real skills, and gain hands-on experience in podcast production, short-form content, and social media execution.



???? No prior experience is required.

???? Training, SOPs, templates, and guidance will be provided.



This role is not for experienced editors or candidates seeking high pay.

This role is for someone hungry to learn, reliable, detail-oriented, and willing to grow.



If you are looking to break into digital marketing, content, or media and want real-world experience inside an agency environment, this role is for you.



Important Compensation Notice (Read Carefully)



Starting pay: $300 USD per month



Full-time internship (40 hours per week)



Performance-based increases possible over time



???? DO NOT APPLY if this compensation does not work for you.

???? Applications asking for higher pay will be automatically rejected.



What You’ll Do

Daily Workflow (approximately 8 hours per day)

Podcast Editing & Basic Production (approximately 2.5 hours per day)



Assist with editing podcast audio and video using provided templates



Trim basic mistakes, pauses, and filler words



Sync audio and video and add intros/outros using SOPs



Export and upload files following step-by-step instructions



Ensure content is clean and professional (not advanced or cinematic editing)



Social Media Content Editing & Repurposing (approximately 2 hours per day)



Help repurpose podcast episodes into short-form videos



Create clips for Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and LinkedIn



Add captions and basic text overlays using templates



Follow brand styles and instructions exactly



Focus on consistency and accuracy, not creativity freedom



Social Media Execution & Publishing (approximately 2 hours per day)



Schedule and publish posts across assigned social platforms



Follow the content calendar and posting instructions



Ensure captions, hashtags, and formatting are correct



Double-check posts before publishing to avoid mistakes



Post-Podcast Production & Content Management (approximately 1.5 hours per day)



Organize files, folders, and assets in shared drives



Upload completed work to ClickUp



Assist with podcast syndication steps



Support basic blog formatting or uploads when instructed



Communicate quickly if something is unclear or missing



What This Internship Is (and Is Not)



This internship IS:



Entry-level



Training-focused



SOP- and template-driven



A learning opportunity with real production work



This internship is NOT:



A senior or advanced editing role



A creative director position



A freelance gig



A high-paying job



What We’re Looking For



No experience required



Willingness to learn and follow instructions



Strong attention to detail



Reliable and consistent work ethic



Basic computer skills



Comfortable working with repetitive tasks



Good written English communication



Open to feedback and improvement



Bonus (not required):



Interest in social media, podcasts, or digital marketing



Familiarity with Canva, CapCut, or basic video tools



Technical Requirements



PC or Mac



Stable internet connection



Headphones for basic audio review



Ability to manage files and folders



Perks and Growth Opportunity



100% remote



Hands-on agency experience



Training with real SOPs and workflows



Clear growth path to Junior or Full-Time Coordinator roles (based on performance)



Opportunity to learn podcast production, content marketing, and social media systems



About Seller Fuel and Toy Launch



Seller Fuel LLC helps toy and game entrepreneurs launch, grow, and scale brands on Amazon and beyond.



Our in-house brand, LakiKid, supports children with Autism, ADHD, and Sensory Processing Disorder. Our products are used in over 300 locations across the United States, including major sports stadiums, aquariums, and zoos.



We also run podcasts, educational programs, and media initiatives supporting founders worldwide.



How to Apply (Read Carefully)

Step 1



Apply using exactly 7 Apply Points on OnlineJobs.ph.



Step 2



In your first reply, answer all 7 questions below.

Missing answers = automatic rejection.



Why are you interested in this internship?



What do you want to learn from this role?



Do you understand this is a $300/month full-time internship? (Yes/No)



What is your current time zone and daily availability?



Do you have a stable internet connection and computer? (Yes/No)



Have you worked with any content or social media tools before? (Optional)



One fun fact about yourself



Please attach your CV or resume (if available). A portfolio is not required.



Final Reminder



???? DO NOT APPLY if $300/month is too low for you.

We are intentionally starting this as an internship, with growth based on performance.

title: Front End React Developer
description:
Job Overview

---------



As a React developer, you will implement new features and maintain existing code using React and other standard tools in the React ecosystem, such as Next and Yarn.



Your duties will include designing software solutions to meet project requirements, maintaining and refactoring existing code, writing tests, and fixing bugs.



Examples:

Provide advice and document best practices on proper React implementation.

Assist in troubleshooting efforts and resolving script issues.

Mentor frontends and encourage a pursuit of knowledge in all things related to React development.



Responsibilities and Duties:

---------



Maintain existing React systems, including fixing bugs

Design and develop new custom components to meet project requirements

Install and configure server environments for React deployments

Maintain and update project dependencies as well as fix any conflicts

Working with other JavaScript developers and software engineers to develop front-end and back-end architecture that’s well structured and flexible, along with the APIs to support it





Qualifications:
years implementing the major React components.

Possess leadership skills and be able to work as a leader and developer.

Solid understanding of React workflows.

Good communication skills.

Knowledge of React and common tools used in the wider React ecosystem, such as Next, Node.js and yarn

Familiarity with common programming tools such as Redux, IDEs, GraphQL, RESTful APIs, Git repositories, TypeScript, version control software, and remote deployment tools

An understanding of common programming paradigms and fundamental React principles, such as React components, hooks, and the React lifecycle



Technical Qualifications
+ years in frontend development and strong React experience.

Graphic design and user experience background.

Understanding of content organization and concepts within information architecture.

Frontend and standard Internet protocols, cross-browser, XML, HTML, HTTP, XHTML, CSS + preprocessors (SASS/LESS/etc), JavaScript (a.k.a. plain or raw), Ajax, React, Redux, Next or other JS frameworks.

Strong experience with GraphQL and RESTful APIs

Familiarity with basic Magento functionality (API = must)

title: Digital PR & Backlink Authority Specialist
description:
(Finance Niche)



Location: Remote

Type: Contract (6–12 months, potential ongoing)

All roles will collaborate during weekly migration sync meetings. Clear communication and documentation are required. Experience working in regulated or financial environments is strongly preferred.



My company is transitioning from a legacy brand into a SaaS business credit infrastructure platform.



As part of this migration, we must preserve backlink authority, update brand mentions, and strengthen financial trust signals.



Role Overview



We are seeking a Digital PR and Link Authority Specialist to manage backlink preservation and growth during our rebrand.



This role is responsible for maintaining and expanding domain authority through compliant, high-quality outreach.



Key Responsibilities

Migration Phase



Audit all referring domains



Identify high-authority backlinks



Conduct outreach to update brand mentions and links



Coordinate affiliate link updates



Support press release distribution for brand evolution



Monitor anchor text distribution



Post-Migration Authority Growth



Secure finance-relevant backlinks



Podcast and founder interview placements



Guest article placements in financial publications



Monitor toxic link risks



Build a consistent referring domain growth strategy



Required Experience



3+ years link building or digital PR



Experience in financial, fintech, or SaaS niches



Demonstrated backlink case studies



Strong outreach and negotiation skills



Understanding of anchor text risk management



Familiarity with Google link quality standards



Success Metrics



Preserve legacy backlink equity



Increase referring domains within 90 days



Improve brand visibility for Brand



Strengthen financial trust signals



Application Requirement



Provide one example of a backlink or digital PR campaign you executed in a competitive niche, including results.

title: Technical Support Specialist – Futures Trading Software
description:
Full Job Description

About Us



Zion Trading Algos (ZTA) is a fast-growing algorithmic trading software company serving futures traders and prop firm traders. We help traders use automation to reduce emotional trading, improve discipline, and take a long-term approach to funded accounts.



We provide white-glove onboarding, ongoing support, and a strong 
 community for our clients. As we continue scaling, we are looking for a dedicated Customer Support Specialist to join our team.



Role Overview



We are hiring a full-time Customer Support Specialist to support ZTA clients during EST trading hours (9:30am–5:00pm EST).



This role requires someone who is:



Highly responsive



Technically capable



Calm under pressure



Professional in written and spoken communication



Comfortable on Zoom screenshare calls



You will be the front line of support for traders using our algorithmic systems inside NinjaTrader and on VPS environments.



Key Responsibilities

1. 
 & Ticket Support



Actively monitor 
 during EST trading hours.



Respond to client questions related to:



NinjaTrader setup



Strategy installation and updates



VPS login and configuration



Basic prop firm account setup



Help manage and resolve support tickets.



Escalate complex issues to senior tea
mbers when necessary.



2. Zoom Troubleshooting Calls



Jump on live Zoom calls with clients to:



Screenshare and troubleshoot NinjaTrader issues



Help install or update algorithms



Verify settings are configured correctly



Diagnose common trading platform errors



You must be comfortable guiding clients step-by-step through technical processes.



3. Prop Firm & Trading Platform Support



Assist clients trading with prop firms (Apex, etc.).



Understand common prop firm rules:



Trailing drawdown



Consistency rules



Daily loss limits



Help clients understand how our algorithms function within those constraints.



4. Community Presence



Maintain a professional and calm tone at all times.



Support traders during red days or drawdown periods.



Reinforce long-term thinking and disciplined system usage.



Keep responses clear, structured, and well-written.



Requirements



Required:



Available Monday–Friday, 9:30am–5:00pm EST



Excellent written and spoken English



Strong troubleshooting skills



Comfortable using:







Zoom



Google Docs / Sheets



Strong attention to detail



Calm and patient personality



Preferred (but not required):



Experience with NinjaTrader



Experience with futures trading



Familiarity with prop firms



Experience supporting trading software



Basic understanding of:



VPS environments



Windows troubleshooting



Installing and importing NinjaScript files



We will train the right candidate on our specific systems.



Ideal Candidate



You are:



Organized and proactive



Comfortable dealing with traders who may be frustrated



Able to explain technical concepts clearly



Not easily overwhelmed



Interested in trading, finance, or fintech



Willing to learn continuously



You do not need to be a professional trader. But you must be comfortable learning the basics of futures and algorithmic trading.



Compensation



Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)



Opportunity to grow into a larger Client Success role



Long-term opportunity with a growing fintech company



Performance-based bonuses possible



How to Apply



Please include:



A short introduction about yourself



Your experience with trading platforms (if any)



Your experience with technical support or troubleshooting



Your availability in EST hours



A short Loom video introducing yourself (optional but preferred)

title: Media Buyer (Meta Ads Specialist)
description:
Media Buyer (Meta Ads Specialist)

We are looking for an experienced, results-driven Media Buyer who lives and breathes Meta advertising. This is not an entry-level role. We need someone who understands strategy, creative testing, data interpretation, and scaling — not just someone who can “boost posts.”

If you know how to turn ad spend into measurable revenue, keep reading.

 

About the Role

As our Meta Ads Specialist, you will be responsible for planning, launching, optimizing, and scaling high-performing ad campaigns across
 and Instagram. You will manage budgets strategically, test creatives intelligently, and make data-backed decisions that drive growth.

You should be equally comfortable inside Ads Manager and inside analytics dashboards.

 

Responsibilities

• Build, launch, and manage Meta ad campaigns from strategy to execution

• Conduct audience research and develop targeting strategies

• Create structured testing plans (creative, hooks, angles, audiences)

• Optimize campaigns daily based on performance metrics

• Scale winning campaigns profitably

• Monitor and improve key KPIs (CPL, CPA, ROAS, CTR, CPM, etc.)

• Install and manage Meta Pixel and Conversion API tracking

• Troubleshoot tracking discrepancies and attribution issues

• Analyze funnel performance and provide strategic recommendations

• Produce clear weekly/monthly performance reports

• Collaborate with creative team on high-converting ad concepts

 

Required Experience

• 3+ years of hands-on experience running Meta ad campaigns

• Proven track record of managing $10,000+ monthly ad budgets (higher preferred)

• Experience scaling campaigns to profitable ROAS

• Strong understanding of Meta Ads Manager structure and best practices

• Experience with A/B testing and creative iteration

• Deep knowledge of conversion tracking, pixels, and attribution

• Ability to analyze data and identify optimization opportunities quickly

• Experience working with lead generation and/or e-commerce campaigns

 

Preferred Experience

• Experience running ads for service-based businesses

• Experience with high-ticket offers

• Familiarity with landing page optimization

• Knowledge of funnel strategy

• Experience using tools like GoHighLevel, Google Analytics, or other CRM platforms

 

What Success Looks Like

• Consistently improving CPA and ROAS

• Clear, proactive communication

• Strategic thinking (not reactive button-pushing)

• Testing mindset with documented learnings

• Data-driven decision making

 

Who This Is NOT For

• Someone who only knows how to boost posts

• Someone who relies on one campaign structure for everything

• Someone who blames performance solely on “the algorithm”

• Someone who needs constant direction

 

Why Join Us?

• Work with growth-focused brands

• Room to scale with performance

• Data-driven culture

• Creative collaboration environment

 

If you’re confident in your ability to turn paid traffic into real revenue, apply with:

1. Your resume

2. Case studies or performance results

3. Monthly budgets you’ve managed

4. Your favorite campaign you’ve ever scaled and why

title: TECHNICAL SUPPORT - RETAIL POS
description:

This is a Remote support services role, so it is imperative that candidates are well-spoken and experienced with providing point of sale tech support for our retail customers.



Customer Training, Diagnose their issues, Test new features, create documentation for new features.



As you learn our system, you will be handling configurations for new clients, helping clients with using our retail management system, Customer Training and troubleshooting. Documenting issues in our Help Desk Portal, client training over the phone/Internet and assisting with software support calls from existing clients.



Concurrently, you will be developing expertise in how we can make our system easier to use. We’re looking for someone to drive results.



This is a great growth opportunity for the right individual.



Characteristics:



- Passionate about client success

- Excellent communication skills is a must

- Prior project management

- Team focused

- Focus on deliverables

- Take direction and work with minimal supervision

- Comfortable working with small to large scale projects

- Desire to grow with company because this position’s path will lead to other opportunities

- Technical aptitude and background highly desired



Responsibilities:

- Ability to adapt quickly to changes in requirements and communicate to project teams

- Interact with other project resources and coordinate resources when needed



Qualifications:



- Retail Point Of Sale Software Experience or Previous experience with POS systems in Retail industry.

- Candidates must have excellent oral and written communication skills

- Prefer at least a 2 year degree in computer field or similar experience.

- Must be able to work alone and in a team environment.

- Basic knowledge of computer hardware and software a must.

- Experience communicating with all levels internally and externally

- Successful experience working directly with customers to resolve issues

- Computer proficiency (including internet and software)

- Strong troubleshooting skills

- Have a desire to enjoy work and tea
mbers



Job Types: Full-time



THIS IS PHILIPPINES NIGHT SHIFT (9:30 P.M TO 5:30 A.M) WITH 1.5 HOURS BREAK

MONDAY TO FRIDAY  [8:30 EST TO 5:30 EST (USA TIME ZONE)]



please respond with "Retail Technical Technical Support" in subject of your response.

title: Luxury E-Book Designer & Layout Specialist
description:
I’m looking for a creative and detail-oriented E-book Designer to transform my written content into a visually stunning, professional e-book. The e-book is focused on credit repair, inquiry deletion, and financial empowerment, and I want it to reflect a modern, trendy, and luxury “girl-boss” vibe.



Responsibilities:

Design and format my e-book (20–30 pages).

Create a visually appealing cover page with luxury editorial vibes (black, purple, gold, Vogue/Forbes inspired).

Use my brand colors (deep purple, black, gold, lavender) throughout.

Add stylish headers, icons, and page layouts that look professional and phone-ready.

Ensure the PDF is easy to read and consistent across devices.



Requirements:

Strong experience in graphic design and e-book layout (portfolio required).

Skilled in Canva, Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, or Illustrator.

Ability to match luxury lifestyle and trendy branding aesthetics.

Creative but able to follow my branding direction.

Reliable and able to deliver within 1–2 weeks.



Nice to Have:

Experience working with entrepreneurs, coaches, or financial service brands.

Ability to create additional social media graphics from the e-book content.

title: Outbound Sales & Operations Lead
description:
Outbound Sales Team Lead



Full-Time | US Company | $8/hr + Performance Bonuses



 



Work with a growing U.S.-based coffee company that’s building something exciting.



We’re fun, enthusiastic, hard-working, and serious about results — and we’re looking for someone who wants to grow with us long-term.



 



Drink Better Coffee & Evara sells:



• Specialty wholesale coffee



• Custom paper cups & lids



• Premium foil delivery bags



 



Role Overview

50% Outbound Sales



50% Sales Operations & Team Leadership



 



You will:



• Make outbound calls daily



• Close new packaging and coffee accounts



• Maintain CRM organization (Zoho)



• Manage dialer campaigns



• Assign and monitor call lists



• Track KPIs and team performance



• Send structured weekly reports



• Maintain accountability and performance standards within the team



Requirements

• 3+ years cold calling experience



• Dialer experience



• CRM experience



• Strong English communication skills



• Organized and detail-oriented mindset



• High responsiveness



Bonus: Real estate cold calling or leadership experience



Performance Expectations (Full-Time Standard)

• 100–150 outbound calls per day



• 12+ new packaging accounts per month



• 1–2 new coffee accounts per month



• Clean CRM logging and disciplined follow-up



Compensation

• $8.00 per hour



• 40 hours per week



• Monday–Friday



• 8:00 AM – 4:30 PM PST (California Time)



Performance-based commission and team bonuses available. Details discussed during interview.



Important

This is not an entry-level telemarketing role.



We are building a structured, performance-driven team and are looking for someone who is:



• Highly responsive



• Organized and disciplined



• Comfortable being held accountable



• Able to lead by example



If you frequently change jobs, miss deadlines, or are slow to communicate, this role will not be a good fit.



To Apply

Please answer the following:



1. What dialer(s) have you used?



2. What KPIs did you track daily?



3. Have you managed other callers? If yes, how many?



4. What CRM systems have you used?



5. Provide your internet speed test result.



Applications without these answers will not be considered.

title: Senior B2B Outbound SDR – UK/EU Fleets & International Distributor Development
description:
Senior B2B Outbound SDR – UK, Europe & International Distributor Development



Full-Time | Performance-Based Growth Role



About ShoulderSink



ShoulderSink is a European manufacturer of professional mobile hand hygiene systems used primarily in commercial vehicles. More than 50,000 professionals use our systems across multiple markets. We are a small team and operate strictly B2B and work with fleet customers and national distributors.



We are expanding across the UK, Europe and selected international markets, including relevant markets such as US and Japan.



The Role

This is a performance-driven outbound role focused on building qualified pipeline in:



- UK fleet market

- European fleet customers

- International distributor markets (including US, Japan and other relevant regions)



This is a full-time role designed for long-term growth. Continued development and expanded responsibility are performance-based.



What You Will Do

- Fleet Development (UK & Europe)

-Cold outreach to fleet managers, operations directors and HSE managers

- Identify current hygiene practices in commercial vehicles

- Generate qualified fleet trials

- Secure structured commercial evaluation meetings

- Distributor Development (International)

- Identify and contact national distributors and importers

- Qualify commercial capability and market coverage

- Secure evaluation meetings

- Move prospects to structured next steps



Over time - International Growth Support

- Contribute to market research and expansion strategy

- Support international trade show preparation

- Potential participation in selected international activities based on performance



General Responsibilities

- High-volume outbound outreach (calls + follow-up)

- Structured CRM documentation

- KPI accountability and weekly reporting



What We Expect

- 3+ years outbound B2B experience

- Proven experience calling US or UK decision-makers

- Strong commercial mindset

- Confident objection handling

- CRM discipline

- Clear, professional English



We are not hiring call-center telemarketers. We are hiring a commercially minded outbound professional capable of engaging decision-makers.



Compensation

- $1,600/month base salary

- Commission per qualified fleet trial

- Commission per qualified distributor evaluation

- 5% first-year revenue share on sourced accounts



Total earnings are STRONGLY performance-driven.



Growth Opportunity

This role is structured for long-term development. Increased responsibility, broader international exposure and participation in trade activities are based on measurable results.



Application Requirement

To apply, please include:

- A short written summary of your outbound B2B experience

- A 60-second audio recording introducing yourself and pitching a B2B product

- Applications without an audio introduction will not be reviewed.

title: Certified Public Accountant (CPA) for a Property Management Company ( Property Management Experience is a MUST )
description:
The CPA will oversee all financial aspects of our property management operations, including accounting, reporting, budgeting, and compliance. This role requires a detail-oriented professional with a deep understanding of real estate accounting, who can provide strategic insights while ensuring accuracy and compliance.



Key Responsibilities

• Manage full-cycle accounting for multiple properties, including accounts payable, receivable, and general ledger functions

• Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

• Ensure compliance with GAAP, tax regulations, and company policies

• Oversee cash flow management, budgeting, and forecasting

• Reconcile bank accounts and monitor financial transactions

• Work with property managers and leadership to provide financial insights and recommendations

• Coordinate with external auditors and tax professionals as needed

• Implement process improvements for efficiency and accuracy



Qualifications

• Active CPA license required

• Property Management Experience is a MUST

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Master’s a plus)

• Minimum 5 years of accounting experience, preferably in property management or real estate

• Experience with property management software preferred

• Advanced Excel and financial modeling skills

• Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities

• Detail-oriented, organized, and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment



Tools & Software



Familiarity with the following tools are preferred:



• Yardi



• RealPage



• QuickBooks



• Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail)



• Microsoft Excel



To apply, please send your application to 
 through OLJ will not be entertained.



As part of our hiring process for the CPA position, we require verification of your active PRC license. Please provide a photo or screenshot of your PRC ID or a PRC verification page showing your name and license status. This information will be used solely for employment verification



Include a short cover letter as well as your resume.



Also include a personalized 2-minute video only introducing yourself and share in the video introduction why you believe you’re a great fit for this role and give one specific example of how you’ve demonstrated attention to detail in your previous CPA work.

title: At-Home Record Retrieval Specialist (USA – HIPAA)
description:
Due to our rapid growth, we are expanding our team and seeking dedicated Work-From-Home Record Retrieval Specialists based in the Philippines. In this role, you will retrieve medical and healthcare-related records for U.S.-based clients, follow up on record requests until completion, and use sound judgment along with our guidance to determine next steps. This is an excellent long-term opportunity for individuals with call-center, telemarketing, or BPO experience who want to grow with a supportive team.



Responsibilities

• Retrieve medical and healthcare records from various providers for U.S. clients.

• Make outbound calls and follow up persistently until requests are completed.

• Provide excellent customer service and maintain professional communication at all times.

• Work 7–8 hours per day, Monday to Friday, aligned with U.S. ET or PT time zones.

• Ensure compliance with HIPAA and all confidentiality requirements



Required Qualifications

• Ability to work U.S. Eastern Time (ET) and/or Pacific Time (PT).

• Prior voice BPO or call-center experience.

• Experience working from home.

• Telemarketing or outbound calling experience.

• Strong verbal and written English communication skills.

• Problem-solving mindset and ability to work independently.

• Dedicated home office with high-speed internet.

• USB headset required.

• Ability to maintain strict confidentiality.

• Entrepreneurial, self-driven work attitude.

• Must pass a criminal background check.

• Experience in healthcare or legal fields is a plus.



What We Offer

• Personalized business training program.

• Opportunity for growth—we promote from within!

• Flexible working hours within required U.S. shifts.

• Friendly, supportive team environment.

• Bi-weekly payments.



We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.



Applications are accepted only through our HR site:

title: B2B Sales Lead Specialist
description:
Henderson Consulting & Associates is Canada's top choice for securing government funding.



Our team of professionally licensed Accountants, Engineers, Technical experts, and Banking professionals create robust applications for government funding programs – including SR&ED tax credits, grants, wage subsidies, and government-backed loans.



We are now expanding our team and are looking for a B2B Sales Lead Specialist. This is a remote job opportunity. We invite all interested candidates to submit their resume and cover letter to 
 without these documents will not be considered. 



Core responsibilities:-

1. Researching target markets and potential customers, and creating campaigns using various channels like
, social media platforms and cold outreach to attract qualified leads, especially through LinkedIn.



2. Building relationships with prospects through personalized, value-driven communication to move them down the sales funnel.



3. Working closely with marketing on campaigns and with the sales team to ensure a seamless and efficient handoff of qualified leads.



4. Data analysis: Tracking lead generation activities, analyzing data, and using insights to adjust strategies and improve campaign effectiveness. 



Key skills and qualifications:-

1. Strong communication and interpersonal skills 

2. Fluent in English, both written and spoken

3. 1-2 years of experience with LinkedIn marketing 

4. Proficiency in using CRM software, sales engagement platforms, and other relevant tools.

5. Experience with inbound B2B sales or marketing strategies.

6. Knowledge of market research, competitive analysis, and data analysis techniques.

7. Ability to develop creative and compelling content and strategies for various channels.

 outreach

title: E-commerce Specialist (Amazon & Walmart)
description:
We are a growing U.S. tea company looking for a detail-oriented E-commerce Specialist to support our daily marketplace operations across Amazon (US & Canada) and Walmart.



Your main responsibility is to keep our product data clean, accurate, and compliant while monitoring operational issues that affect revenue and customer experience.



If you enjoy working with reports, identifying discrepancies, and keeping systems organized, you’ll thrive here.

 with your resume.

title: DTC Email Designer
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Graphic Designer to elevate our creative output with a primary focus on performance-driven creatives in Klaviyo. This role is full-time and in-house (remote). We're not hiring freelance or agency.



This role is ideal for someone who is creative but performance-aware — someone who understands that good design is not just about aesthetics, but about driving clicks, conversions, and revenue.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Create landing page visuals, banners,
 graphics, and other DTC marketing assets

- Edit and optimise website product images 

- Develop new creative concepts and designs based on performance data and brand direction

- Produce variations of winning creatives for testing (different headlines, layouts, visuals, offers)

- Collaborate effectively with the Copywriter to iterate based on performance insights

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve angles, messaging, and hooks

- Monitor competitors’ designs to identify gaps or opportunities

- Upskill on DTC creative trends and platform best practices



Requirements

- Full-time remote, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Strong visual design fundamentals (layout, hierarchy, typography, color)

- Able to design with e-commerce marketing intent, not just aesthetics

- Comfortable creating multiple variations quickly for testing

- Highly organized, execution-focused, independent

- Skills in Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma (3D jewelry rendering experience is a huge plus)

- Experience with Klaviyo and Shopify 

- Basic understanding of DTC copywriting 



What We Offer

- Fully remote with competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays (following local PH calendar)

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "DTC
 Designer – (Your Name)”. Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) Tell us about the tools you used, your process, and results relevant to this role. 

3) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem in your workplace. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

4) Please submit as much of your portfolio as possible. Submitting more work will help us make a more informed decision. Work can include anything within DTC e-commerce industry, but ideally aligned to the role you are applying for. If you don’t have DTC experience, submit your best work portfolio. Strong portfolios outside this role may be considered for other roles. 

5) Pick one project from the attached portfolio in question (4) that you are most proud of and answer the questions below. We want to see your ability to clearly explain what you did, your role, your reasoning, and the results of your work. You may optionally pick more than 1 project to highlight additional skills.

- What the project was

- Your specific contribution

- Why you approached it this way

- The results or impact (if any)

title: Senior GoHighLevel (GHL) Build Expert – Full-Time
description:
To apply
 
 a loom video of your experience - your last complicated workflow you built - and anything else you think will help you stand out from other applicants.



We are a performance-focused marketing company looking to bring on a senior-level GoHighLevel (GHL) Build Expert to work full-time, in-house, alongside one of the original GoHighLevel trainers. This role is for someone who truly understands how to architect, build, and scale advanced GHL systems for real marketing environments. We are not interested in hiring agencies, white-label teams, or outsourced firms. This position is for an individual expert with a proven track record.



This role is fully remote, but candidates must be available to work consistently during AV / EST business hours. Excellent, near-perfect English communication skills are required, both written and spoken, as you will be collaborating closely with leadership and internal teams on system design and execution.



As our GoHighLevel Build Expert, you will be responsible for turning marketing strategy into fully functional, scalable GHL systems. This includes designing complete account structures, building funnels and websites inside GoHighLevel, creating and executing advanced workflow automation plans, and implementing API-driven integrations. You will be expected to think in systems, not just features, and to plan automation logic thoroughly before building. Clean structure, clear logic, and long-term maintainability are critical in this role.



You will regularly build high-converting websites, funnels, and landing pages directly inside GoHighLevel, including forms, surveys, calendars, booking logic, membership areas, and payment flows using Stripe. You should understand how these components work together to support lead generation, appointment setting, onboarding, and fulfillment for marketing clients. Speed, mobile responsiveness, and user experience are expected standards, not afterthoughts.



A major part of this role involves workflow strategy and execution. You must be able to design complex automation systems that handle lead intake, pipeline movement, appointment reminders, follow-ups via SMS,
, voi
, and AI, internal task assignment, reactivation campaigns, and client onboarding. You will be responsible for building workflows that are efficient, reliable, and easy to debug, as well as optimizing and refactoring existing automations as systems evolve.



Strong technical capability is required. You should be comfortable working with the GoHighLevel API, webhooks, and third-party automation tools such as Zapier or Make. You will be expected to integrate GoHighLevel with external tools including CRMs, payment processors,
 platforms, membership systems, and tracking tools, while understanding data flow, API limits, and error handling. This is not a surface-level integration role; deep understanding is required.



You will work closely with one of the original GoHighLevel trainers, as well as with internal marketing strategists and operators. Clear communication, ownership of your work, and the ability to execute without hand-holding are essential. This role requires someone who can take direction, apply strategic thinking, and deliver high-quality builds consistently.



To be considered, you must have advanced, real-world GoHighLevel experience with verifiable examples of complex systems you have built. You must be able to demonstrate a strong track record, provide references, and clearly explain how you have handled workflow complexity, integrations, and scalable system design in past roles. This position is not suitable for beginners, template-only builders, or anyone still learning GoHighLevel fundamentals.



In return, this role offers long-term stability, direct access to top-tier GHL expertise, and the opportunity to build serious systems that directly impact client success and company growth. If you are a true GoHighLevel expert who takes pride in clean builds, smart automation, and scalable architecture, we want to hear from you.

title: Marketing & Content Creator
description:
The Role:



This is a hybrid marketing + content creation role. You’ll manage our social media presence, plan and execute content strategy, AND create short-form video content (TikToks, Reels, Shorts) for our apps. You’re the full package — you can think strategically about what to post and when, but you can also open CapCut, record a voiceover, and make a video that actually performs. You’ll be working across multiple apps, so the work stays varied and interesting.



What You’ll Do



Content Creation (50%)

• Create 6–12 short-form videos per month across our app portfolio (TikTok, Reels, Shorts)

• Produce gameplay clips, screen recordings with voiceover, app walkthroughs, and trending format content

• Stay on top of TikTok/Reels trends, sounds, and hooks in the gaming and app space

• Adapt your content style for different apps — a game needs different energy than a utility app

• Deliver raw and edited video files for repurposing across platforms



Marketing & Social Media Management (40%)

• Manage and grow Degen Game Studios’ social media accounts (TikTok, Instagram, X/Twitter, YouTube)

• Build and maintain a content calendar across all apps and platforms

• Schedule and publish content using tools like Buffer, Later, or similar

• Monitor and respond to community engagement — comments, DMs, app reviews

• Research trending hashtags, sounds, and content formats relevant to our apps

• Identify influencer and cross-promotion opportunities



Analytics & Growth (10%)

• Track key metrics: downloads, engagement rates, follower growth, video performance

• Assist with App Store Optimization (ASO) for both App Store and Google Play — keyword research, screenshot ideas, description updates

• Help set up and monitor basic paid ad campaigns when needed (Apple Search Ads, Meta Ads)

• Provide a brief monthly summary of what’s working and what to try next



Requirements

• 1–2+ years of experience in social media marketing, content creation, or both

• Strong portfolio of short-form video content (TikTok, Reels, or Shorts) — share your work

• Comfortable with voiceover and screen recording (face on camera optional, voice required)

• Proficient with video editing tools (CapCut, Premiere, DaVinci, or similar)

• Understanding of what performs on TikTok and Reels — hooks, pacing, trending formats

• Experience with social media scheduling and analytics tools

• Strong written communication and ability to work independently

• Genuine interest in mobile gaming, apps, or tech content



Nice to Have

• Experience marketing mobile apps or games on iOS and Android

• Existing audience in the mobile gaming or app review niche

• Familiarity with ASO for both App Store and Google Play

• Experience with Apple Search Ads or Meta Ads Manager

• Basic graphic design skills (Canva, Figma, etc.)

• Experience managing multiple products or brands simultaneously



Why This Role

• Get in on the ground floor of a growing indie studio with multiple titles in the pipeline

• Creative freedom — you’ll shape the brand voice and content strategy from scratch

• Flexible, remote, part-time schedule that works around your life

• Opportunity to grow with the studio as we scale — more apps, bigger budgets, more responsibility

title: Staffing Coordinator (Home Health Agency)
description:
Job description:



Job Title: Staffing Representative - Home Health Therapy (Remote, Night Shift)



Location: Work from Home - (U.S. Pacific Standard Time)



About the Company

A List Therapy Group is a California-based provider of in-home physical, occupational, and speech therapy services. We partner with over 300 agencies and hospitals, delivering exceptional patient care through our large network of licensed therapists.



Position Overview

We are hiring a full-time Staffing Representative to work remotely. This role coordinates therapist assignments, manages incoming referrals, updates patient records, and ensures fast, accurate communication with both clinicians and U.S.-based partner agencies. You will also be responsible for problem-solving staffing challenges and maintaining strong professional relationships with our therapists.



Key Duties



• Review and respond to incoming patient referrals in real time.

• Assign therapists based on location, coverage area, and specialty.

• Enter and update patient data in CliniConnects and TherapySync.

• Follow up on pending cases and manage restaffing when needed.

• Send consent forms and required documents to therapists.

• Communicate promptly via WhatsApp, phone, and
.

• Maintain positive working relationships with therapists to encourage engagement and reliability.

• Identify and resolve staffing issues quickly to prevent delays in patient care.

• Maintain accurate records and update rate sheets as needed.



Qualifications



• Experience in home health staffing, healthcare scheduling, or medical coordination preferred.

• Strong English communication skills (written and spoken).

• Proven problem-solving abilities and conflict resolution skills.

• Ability to build and maintain professional relationships with therapists.

• Highly organized, able to multitask, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

• Proficiency with Google Workspace, WhatsApp, and data entry systems.

• Own computer, noise-cancelling headset, and stable internet connection.

• Comfortable using Hubstaff and 
 with a working camera.

• Willing to work night shift: Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–6:00 PM PST (Philippines time: 12:00 AM–9:00 AM).



Why Join Us



• Competitive pay for remote work.

• Work directly with a U.S.-based healthcare company.

• Supportive, team-focused environment with growth opportunities.



How to Apply



• Please send a short cover letter highlighting your experience relevant to the role you are applying for, and include your answers to the questions below:

1. How many years of experience do you have working for a home health provider company?

2. How many years of experience do you have working as a staffing coordinator?

• Kindly monitor your OLJ inbox, as I will send the final interview link and your schedule there if you are shortlisted for the position.

title: Automation and Marketing Systems Strategist (GoHighLevel)
description:
WE ARE HIRING: Automation and Marketing Systems Strategist (GoHighLevel)

Schedule: Full-Time, PST Business Hours

Industry: Countertop Fabrication and Installation



About the Company:

A fast-growing countertop fabrication and installation company serving both commercial and residential clients. With 28 tea
mbers across office, shop, and field operations, we are expanding into retail and opening our first showroom.



Our focus is building the operational backbone of a marketing-driven business, including CRM systems, follow-up automation, and structured internal communication. We are looking for a strategist to design and optimize how our company runs behind the scenes.



Role Overview:

This role is both strategic and operational. You will take ownership of our GoHighLevel ecosystem, design operational workflows, and improve lead conversion across the full customer lifecycle.



Lead to Qualification to Nurture to Appointment to Sale to Follow-Up to Referral



You will help plan marketing initiatives, build automation systems, improve follow-up processes, and implement structured internal communication workflows.



Key Responsibilities:

* Own and optimize GoHighLevel CRM, pipelines, and automation (SMS,
, voi
, reminders)

* Design and execute marketing campaigns and customer journeys

* Ensure fast response times to new leads and maintain clean, accurate data

* Build structured internal communication systems for office, shop, and field teams

* Assist with landing pages, funnels,
 and SMS campaigns, and KPI tracking

* Train tea
mbers and document SOPs for lead handling and internal communication



Requirements:

* Hands-on experience with GoHighLevel

* Strong automation design skills aligned with business processes

* Knowledge of marketing funnels, lead conversion, and operational workflows

* Available during PST business hours

* Clear communicator who is organized and process-driven



Strongly Preferred:

* Previous marketing strategy experience

* Experience in home services, construction, or local service businesses

* Funnel optimization and lifecycle marketing experience

* Experience setting up internal communication systems (Slack, 
, or similar tools)



Bonus Skills:

* Website updates and landing page optimization

* Basic graphic design or video editing skills

* Ability to collaborate with designers and media buyers



Why Join Us:

* Architect the operational backbone of a growing company

* Direct collaboration with leadership

* High impact on revenue and efficiency

* Opportunity to build systems from the ground up

* Clear growth path into Operations or Marketing Leadership



If you are passionate about building systems that drive growth and efficiency, we would love to hear from you.



APPLY NOW!

title: Healthcare Recruiter
description:
Job description:



We are a growing U.S.-based healthcare company seeking a Recruiter / Interview Specialist to support therapist hiring across multiple departments.



This role is call-heavy and interview-focused, with additional responsibility for coordinating hiring needs and tracking recruitment progress. Approximately 90% of your work will involve phone interviews with therapist candidates.



If you are not comfortable being on calls for most of your shift, this role is not a good fit.



Role Overview



• You will conduct daily phone interviews with licensed therapists (PT, OT, ST, PTA, COTA), coordinate with internal teams on hiring needs, and manage the recruitment pipeline from job posting through candidate handoff.

• You are the first point of contact for candidates and a key link between departments, so professionalism, organization, and communication are essential.



Key Responsibilities



• Interviewing & Screening (Primary Focus)

• Conduct high-volume phone interviews daily with therapist candidates.

• Screen candidates for: Licensure and credentials, Experience and specialties, Availability and geographic coverage,



Communication skills and professionalism

• Clearly explain roles, expectations, and next steps.

• Identify red flags and escalate concerns when necessary.

• Recruitment Coordination & Follow-Ups

• Follow up with candidates after interviews as needed.

• Coordinate with internal departments (staffing, operations, leadership) to understand current and upcoming hiring needs.

• Schedule next steps and hand off qualified candidates appropriately.

• Maintain timely and professional communication with candidates throughout the process.

• Job Posting & Process Tracking

• Post job openings on approved platforms as hiring needs change.

• Track candidates through each stage of the recruitment process.

• Keep recruitment trackers or ATS accurate and up to date.

• Provide basic updates on hiring progress when requested.



What We’re Looking For



• Comfortable being on the phone most of the workday.

• Clear, confident, professional speaking voice.

• Strong listening and judgment skills.

• Highly organized and detail-oriented.

• Able to manage follow-ups and coordination without losing 
ntum.



Qualifications



• 1–2+ years of experience in: Recruiting, Healthcare staffing, HR screening, Call center interviewing

• Excellent spoken and written English.

• Comfortable conducting multiple interviews per day.

• Familiar with Google Workspace (Sheets, Docs).

• Bonus: Experience recruiting healthcare professionals or independent contractors.



Requirements



• Reliable internet connection.

• Quiet, professional work environment for calls.

• Ability to work U.S. (PST) business hours.

• Part-time or full-time availability (to be discussed).



How to apply



• Please send a brief cover letter outlining your experience that is aligned or related to the role you are applying for. Make sure to include the specific tasks you have handled, as well as the link to your resume.

• Kindly monitor your OLJ inbox, as I will send the final interview link and your schedule there if you are shortlisted for the position.



Job Type: Part-time



Benefits:



• Paid training

• Work from home



Experience:



• Recruiting: 2 years (Required)

• Healthcare Staffing: 1 year (Required)

• Work Location: Remote

title: 3D Product Video Creator
description:
About the Role

We’re seeking a talented digital visual artist/video creator to produce 2 high-quality, social media-ready videos per month showcasing our client's products and machines. Using provided image renders, you’ll create realistic 3D product visuals, incorporate text captions, and generate voiceovers using AI tools like Kling or Higgsfield to make content polished and engaging.



Key Responsibilities: 

- Transform 2D product renders into dynamic, realistic 3D videos.

- Highlight products/machines from multiple angles using lighting, shadows, and textures for a professional, polished look.

- Add text captions, titles, and annotations for social media readability.

- Create voiceovers or narration using AI tools (e.g., Kling, Higgsfield) as needed.

- Deliver 2 fully produced, social media-optimized videos per month.



Requirements:

- Experience in 3D visualization, motion graphics, or product animation.

- Familiarity or openness to using AI tools for voiceover and captioning.

- Strong understanding of lighting, composition, and realistic rendering techniques.

- Experience producing content optimized for social media formats.

- Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and take creative direction.



About UpCierge

UpCierge is a boutique firm providing high-quality virtual assistant services to a select clientele. We value our tea
mbers and foster a supportive, flexible, and rewarding work environment.

title: Creative Designer (AI tools Image ads & Video Ads) Dropshipping
description:
Creative Designer (AI Image Ads & Video Ads) – Dropshipping



We are looking for a Creative Designer who is skilled in working with AI image and video tools to create high-converting ad creatives for dropshipping products.



The role focuses on turning products from our store into image ads and video ads using AI tools (such as Nana Banana Pro and similar platforms), across different styles and prompts.



What you’ll be doing:



Creating AI-generated image ads for dropshipping products using AI tools



Creating AI video ads (short-form ad creatives) using AI video platforms



Translating product features into strong ad visuals for Meta / TikTok / paid ads



Working with different prompts and creative angles per product



Improving and iterating creatives based on examples and feedback



What we’re looking for:



Strong experience with AI image generation tools (e.g. Nana Banana Pro or similar)



Experience with AI video tools for ad creation



Someone who is hands-on, creative, and understands how to work with prompts



Able to come up with the right inputs/prompts independently, not just copy instructions



Experience with dropshipping products and ad creatives is a big plus



How we work:



We will provide examples and references for both image and video ads



You’re expected to use these as inspiration and create your own optimized versions



This is an ongoing collaboration if the quality and workflow match



Ideal candidate:



Creative mindset + technical understanding of AI tools



Understands what works in paid ads, not just “nice images”



Reliable, fast, and detail-oriented



If this sounds like you, please apply with:



Examples of AI image ads and/or AI video ads you’ve created



A short explanation of which AI tools you use

title: Job Title: Social Media Growth & Brand Systems Manager (Performance-Based Role)

Responsibilities



Content Production

GoHighLevel Execution

Brand Infrastructure

title: Immediate hire Shopify Product VA with Personalized product or/Print on Demand Experience
description:
About Us



HouseSensationsArt is a fast-growing American manufacturing and e-commerce brand specializing in custo
tal décor, personalized gifts, and home products. We sell across Shopify, Etsy, Amazon, TikTok Shop, and eBay. As we continue to expand, we are seeking a skilled Virtual Assistant who is highly experienced in Shopify personalization workflows.





Position Overview



We are looking for a **Shopify Expert** with hands-on experience managing personalized or print-on-demand (POD) products. **Zepto. Zakeke, Teeninblue,  or CustomilyProduct Personalizer experience is plus**, along with a strong understanding of conditional logic, customization flows, SEO, and product optimization. You will work closely with our remote team based in the Philippines and assist our U.S. team as needed.







Responsibilities



* Manage and optimize Shopify personalized products

* Build and edit Zepto Product Personalizer setups

* Create and manage conditional logic for customized products

* Update product options, variants, pricing, and personalization input fields

* Improve product listings: titles, descriptions, SEO, alt text, and images

* Upload and organize product images and mockups

* Ensure ADA-compliant alt text

* Conduct SEO and keyword research for Shopify

* Assist with customer service tasks when needed

* Perform research and clerical work

* Follow SOPs and execute tasks with accuracy

* Support basic graphic design tasks (mockups, product images, simple edits)

* Use ChatGPT to assist with content creation, optimization, and listing updates

* Consistently communicate with the team and meet deadlines



Requirements



* Minimum 2  year Shopify experience (required)

* Hands-on Zepto Product Personalizer experience (required)**

* Strong understanding of **conditional logic** and personalized product workflows

* Familiarity with **print-on-demand** and customized product processes

* Experience with Shopify SEO: titles, tags, descriptions, alt text

* Graphic design skills (Canva, Photoshop, or similar tools)

* Fluent, professional English writing

* Strong attention to detail

* Ability to follow instructions and complete tasks independently

* Reliable communication

* Must be able to work **11 PM – 5 AM GMT**

* Stable high-speed internet and reliable computer

* Experience with Google Workspace

* Customer service experience is a plus







Salary and Benefits

* $3 per hour

* Weekly pay via Wise

* Performance-based raises available - review after 90 days

Work Hours are 11 PM to 5 AM GMT - 30 hours per week with the opportunity for additional hours as work is available 

Eligibility for performance bonus after  days of service

title: Experienced Social Media Manager and Video Editor
description:
JoshxTrades and Bison Blueprint is looking for a Part Time Social Media Manager to handle it's social media presence. JoshxTrades is a online stock trading community hosted in Discord that seeks to share our top stock and options picks with community members for a monthly fee. We are also building a stock trading course for a premium fee. We currently use all social media platforms including Instagram, Tiktok,
,
/X, Youtube. This is all managed via Hootsuite. You can find us on most social media platforms 



The responsibilities of the job include:

- Video editing for short form and long form videos using either Riverside or other technologies

- Planning and scheduling social media posts on all platforms using Hootsuite 

- Creating success cards celebrating our wins on alerted stocks to create a sense of FOMO for potential users 

- Managing our store and product listing on WHOP to increase conversions 

- Creating trading meme and viral videos to entertain our audience

- Schedule podcasts via Podmatch with podcast hosts - use those videos for additional content 

- Create Call to Action stories that are posted on a regular schedule 

- Special marketing projects as assigned 



The outcomes of your actions that will be measured:

- Growing social media posts exposure via views and time viewed leading to virality 

- Growing social media followers 

- Converting followers into paid customers 



The #1 thing we avoid with our brand is that we NEVER use AI for anything, because the brand is focused around a personal connection with me as an influencer. Some tools that use AI to shorten editing times are OK but serious candidates will be required to show that they can perform the job without the help of AI to avoid our content become AI slop. 



Please don't send in an AI generated spam resume,
, and cover letter - I can spot them from a mile away and won't read them.. Please just focus on providing me three things:

1. A list of social media accounts you have worked for in the past so I can review your work 

2. A link or a Google Drive link to a copy of short and long form videos that you have personally edited for another brand

3. A description of your experience working with influencers and service brands (as opposed to product brand) in the US only

title: Ad & Creative Designer (Graphics + AI Performance)
description:
Join Our Team at 7 Figure Dojo!



We’re looking for a Graphic Designer with a performance mindset and strong AI fluency — someone who can produce scroll-stopping ad creatives at scale while leveraging AI tools to accelerate production, testing, and optimization.



This role is hands-on in ad creative production first, with a focus on conversion-driven performance design and AI-assisted workflow systems to ensure client campaigns not only look great but perform at a high level.



You should be comfortable combining design fundamentals, marketing psychology, performance data, and AI tools to increase creative velocity and improve CTR, CVR, and CPL.





Key Responsibilities:



I. Ad & Social Graphics (Primary)

* Design high-converting static and lightweight motion graphics for paid social (Meta, TikTok), display, and organic channels.

* Use AI tools (e.g., Midjourney, DALL·E, Firefly, Runway, Canva AI, ChatGPT, etc.) to:

- Generate concepts, visual variations, and creative hooks

- Accelerate asset production

- Enhance images and backgrounds

- Produce rapid creative testing variants

* Create multiple creative variations (hooks, headlines, layouts, colorways, formats) to support structured A/B testing.

* Adapt designs to multiple aspect ratios (1:1, 4:5, 9:16, 16:9) and platform specifications.

* Collaborate closely with Media Buyers to align creatives with offers, audiences, messaging angles, and KPI goals.

* Iterate rapidly based on performance data and testing insights.



II. AI-Driven Creative Systems

* Build repeatable AI-assisted creative workflows to increase output without sacrificing quality.

* Develop prompt systems and AI templates to generate scalable ad variations.

* Combine AI-generated assets with professional design refinement for polished, brand-aligned outputs.

* Use AI tools to speed up copy ideation and creative angle development (in collaboration with the marketing team).

* Stay current with emerging AI design tools and recommend improvements to internal workflows.



III. Brand & Visual Systems

* Apply or create lightweight brand kits (color systems, typography, layout frameworks) for consistent performance campaigns.

* Retouch, cut out, enhance, and AI-augment client photos with overlays, messaging frames, and ad-ready treatments.

* Prepare modular, editable ad templates for rapid iteration and scaling.

* Ensure AI-generated content remains brand-safe, compliant, and visually cohesive.



IV. Collaboration & Workflow

* Work from briefs, moodboards, and references — while proactively proposing AI-assisted, test-driven creative angles.

* Maintain organized design systems, prompt libraries, version control, and asset repositories.

* Collaborate cross-functionally with Media Buyers and Copywriters.

* Translate performance data into new creative hypotheses and creative refresh strategies.



V. Quality Control

* Proof for accuracy (copy, pricing, disclaimers, dates, logos).

* Ensure accessibility standards (contrast, readability, hierarchy).

* Confirm all exports meet platform requirements (dimensions, file size, format).

* Review AI-generated outputs for visual integrity and brand alignment.

* Revision Expectations

- Designs should require no more than 2 structured revision rounds when briefed correctly.

- Creative submissions must reflect thoughtful interpretation of the brief, performance intent, and brand standards.



VI. Continuous Improvement

* Stay ahead of trends in:

- Paid social creative

- Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) in ad creative

- AI-assisted design workflows

* Regularly review campaign data with Media Buyers and generate new test angles.

* Propose new AI tools or automation systems to improve output and performance.



VI. Performance Indicators

* Creative Velocity: Consistently meets or exceeds weekly creative production quotas.

* Performance Lift: Designs contribute to measurable improvements in CTR, CVR, CPL, and ROAS.

* Testing Discipline: Delivers multiple structured variations per brief and tracks results.

* AI Leverage: Demonstrates efficient use of AI tools to increase output and iteration speed.

* Brand Alignment: Campaign assets reflect brand guidelines with minimal rework.

* Operational Hygiene: Clean file organization, prompt libraries, naming conventions, and structured handoffs.





Portfolio Requirements (Mandatory)



To be considered for this role, applicants must submit a portfolio that clearly demonstrates performance-driven design experience.



Your portfolio must include:

* Paid social ad creatives (Meta, Instagram, TikTok, etc.).

* Examples of multiple creative variations for the same offer (hooks, formats, colorways, angles).

* Performance metrics when available (CTR, CPL, CVR, ROAS, etc.).

* Before/after examples or A/B test comparisons (if applicable).

* Landing pages or funnel designs (if available).





Qualifications

* 1-2 years of experience in graphic design for paid social (Meta/IG/TikTok preferred).

* Strong proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, or Figma.

* Demonstrated experience using AI tools in creative production (Midjourney, Firefly, Runway, Canva AI, ChatGPT, etc.).

* Strong understanding of conversion-focused ad design principles and A/B testing.

* Ability to balance creative intuition with performance data.

* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, metrics-driven environment.





Salary

$1100 - $1600 per month based on experience



This is a performance-driven role with clear room for growth as output and campaign performance improve. Compensation is based on results and impact — not hours on the clock.

title: Social Media & Marketing Assistant – Renewable Energy (Scotland Focus)
description:
Social Media & Marketing Assistant – Renewable Energy (Scotland Focus)

We officially launch on March 2nd, 2026 and are starting from zero. Our goal is to become a leading renewable energy brand in Scotland, helping homeowners reduce energy bills and carbon emissions.



We are looking for a proactive, results-driven Social Media & Marketing Assistant to build our digital presence from the ground up, organically generating qualified leads for our sales team.



The Role

title: Administrative Support Specialist
description:
Job Title: Administrative Support Specialist



Location: Remote



Job Type: Full-Time



Experience Level: Entry Level to Junior Level - Recent College Graduates May Apply



About Us:

VCS is dedicated to helping veterans navigate the VA claims process with ease and confidence. We are seeking a detail-oriented Administrative Support Specialist to join our growing team. This is an entry to junior level position in regards to work experience and who are looking to make a meaningful impact on US veterans’ lives.



Job Summary:

The Administrative Support Specialist provides direct clerical and administrative assistance to the Claims Coach in support of business operations. The specialist will handle a variety of tasks, including managing communication, organizing client documentation, and ensuring efficient workflow processes.



Key Responsibilities:



• Email & Communication Management:

Review, organize, and annotate the Claims Coach’s emails.

o Respond to low-level emails on behalf of the coach when necessary.



• Phone & Messaging Support:

o Review voicemail and text messages on the coach’s phone line.

o Respond when needed and relay important messages.



• Client Documentation & Organization:

o Organize client documents in the company’s data storage system.

o Ensure documents are properly labeled according to company naming conventions.

o Track submitted client documentation and follow up on missing items.



• File Management & Workflow Support:

o Create and maintain online folders in the company’s data storage system.

o Prepare documents for digital signatures using the company’s e-signature tool.



• Client Interaction & Support:

o Receive inbound client calls and perform outbound calls as required.

o Serve as a point of contact for clients assigned to the coach.

o Address client concerns promptly and escalate as needed.



• Operational Support:

o Utilize AI tools to develop documentation supporting business operations.

o Draft and send emails using company templates or customized responses.

o Identify and recommend improvements to company operations.



Qualifications:

• Strong customer service and/or sales experience.

• College graduate (any major considered).

• Ability to work remotely with minimal supervision.

• Strong problem-solving skills – ability to define problems, collect data, and draw valid conclusions.

• Ability to interpret and follow detailed instructions.

• Comfortable working under pressure in a fast-paced environment.

• Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and stay organized in a growing company.

• Strong attention to detail and a diligent work ethic.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to maintain confidentiality when handling sensitive client information.



Preferred Qualifications:

• Background in healthcare or medical fields.

• Experience in sales is a plus.

• Experience using CRM systems and Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Drive, etc.).



What We Offer:

• Competitive salary and benefits package.

• Opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of veterans.

• A supportive and collaborative work environment.

• Professional development opportunities.



Compensation and Benefits

• Starting Salary: $450 - $650 USD per month, commensurate with experience. NOTE the support specialist may also receive monthly payouts (coach bonus) from his/her assigned claims coaches. These monthly payouts when totaled can exceed the salary coming from the company.

• Bonuses: Eligible for monthly, quarterly, and annual bonuses based on personal and company performance. Will also be eligible for spot awards that can include monetary bonus, gift cards, extra time off, or non-monetary recognition.

• 13 Month Salary: prorated based off hiring date.

• Salary Increase: Opportunity for a salary increase after a 90-day probation period for exceptional performance and goal achievement.

• Work From Home: Opportunity to work from designated home office and given IT credit to help with setting up his/her workstation.

• Paid Time Off: 10 days of PTO plus an additional day off for each of the 11 US Federal Holidays.

• Professional Development: Possible opportunities for courses and training related to the role within the company.



How to Apply: Please reply here in Onlinejobs.ph and complete the VCS Administrative Support Specialist questionnaire located at: https://forms.gle/M56o8SbQwWUKEGvq6

title: Internal Operations Specialist
description:
We are seeking for an Internal Operations Specialist in the Residential & Commercial Field Services industry.



We are looking for someone highly organized and detail-oriented who can support field operations behind the scenes. In simple terms — you will make sure our crews have the materials, vehicles, tools, systems access, and support they need to do their jobs efficiently.



This role supports services such as pest control, janitorial, pool care, landscaping, and exterior cleaning. If you enjoy managing processes, tracking assets, working with vendors, and keeping operations organized and audit-ready, this role is for you.



What You’ll Really Be Doing:

Purchasing & Materials

Process purchase orders with correct coding and vendor details.

Order and track field supplies (chemicals, cleaning materials, landscaping supplies, PPE, etc.).

Monitor daily spend and help control costs.

Maintain updated vendor lists and pricing.



IT & Asset Support

Coordinate system access for field employees (logins, software, MFA).

Track and issue laptops, tablets, phones, fuel cards, and company cards.

Manage onboarding and offboarding asset recovery.

Help resolve device or access issues by coordinating with IT.



Fleet Management

Help manage company vehicles and equipment using Fleetio and telematics systems.

Track preventive maintenance schedules and ensure compliance.

Monitor registrations, inspections, insurance, and renewals.

Reconcile fleet-related invoices and investigate billing discrepancies.



Finance & Reporting Support

Track CapEx purchases like vehicles, trailers, and equipment.

Monitor lease expirations and send renewal alerts.

Maintain dashboards for fleet utilization, spend per job, and operational KPIs.



Compliance & Process Improvement

Maintain SOPs for purchasing, fleet use, fuel cards, and chemical handling.

Keep documentation audit-ready.

Identify ways to reduce waste, downtime, and unnecessary spending.



What We’re Really Looking For:

5 years of experience supporting field operations, procurement, or fleet management.

Experience in industries like pest control, janitorial, landscaping, pool care, or similar field services.

Hands-on experience with Fleetio or similar fleet management tools.

Strong spreadsheet skills (pivot tables, lookups, data tracking).

Experience managing purchase orders and vendor relationships.

Detail-oriented, organized, and strong follow-through.

Comfortable working with data and dashboards.



Nice to Have:

Experience with Ford Telematics, Emburse, ERP systems (NetSuite or QuickBooks).

Exposure to insurance tracking or lease management.

Basic knowledge of OSHA/EPA guidelines for field operations.



Requirements:

Updated Resume/CV.

Reliable internet connection and personal computer.

Ability to work in a structured, process-driven environment.

Willingness to support multi-site operations across different markets.



Benefits:

Competitive salary based on experience.

Performance-based incentives tied to operational KPIs.

PTO and paid holidays.

HMO for you and your dependents

Opportunity to grow in a systems-driven, high-performance environment.



Join our team now and be part of the top 1% talent in the Philippines!

title: Personal Injury Demand Writer - Legal Assistance

This position will assist the Pre-Litigation Case Manager with case tasks to ensure cases progress efficiently.



This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with attorneys, medical providers, and insurance adjusters. The assistant will prioritize drafting demand letters, medical summaries, and gathering essential documents. 



Key Responsibilities & Expectations:

- Maintain detailed notes on client interactions and case status in the case management system.

- Gather, organize, and manage medical records, bills, and other necessary documentation.

- Ensure clients are signing intake documents, HIPAA forms, and other required paperwork.

- Track client medical treatment progress, ensuring proper follow-ups and completion of treatment.

- Coordinate with medical providers to obtain medical records, bills, and treatment updates.

- Draft demand letters

- Work closely with the case manager to ensure efficient progress on cases

- Identify and suggest improvements in procedures and processes to enhance efficiency and organization.



Required Qualifications & Skills:

1+ years (2+ preferred) of experience in personal injury case management, claims handling, or a related legal support role.

Familiarity with medical terminology, billing, and insurance claims processes.

Strong understanding of personal injury law, legal procedures, and case management practices.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with team, medical providers, and insurance adjusters.

High level of organization and attention to detail to manage multiple cases and deadlines.

Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.
