title: Talent Recruitment Specialist (Bilingual)
description:
We are seeking for a Specialist, Talent Recruitment in the Property Care / Field Services industry.



We are looking for a high-energy recruiter who can quickly find, screen, and schedule field workers across multiple markets. In simple terms — your job is to make sure our branches are never short-staffed.



This is a high-volume recruiting role. You will actively search for technicians, crew members, and field supervisors — not wait for them to apply. If you enjoy sourcing candidates, moving fast, and treating recruiting like sales, this role is for you.



Bilingual English & Spanish is required.



What You’ll Really Be Doing:

Sourcing (Finding Candidates)

Generate 50+ new candidate leads per day using Indeed, LinkedIn, Craigslist,
 Groups, and other platforms.

Proactively message, call, or text candidates to spark interest.

Build a strong pipeline for every open role.

Screening (Qualifying Candidates)

Review resumes quickly.

Conduct phone or text screenings within 2 hours of application.

Confirm basic qualifications (Driver’s License, location, experience).

Only pass qualified candidates to hiring managers.



Interview Scheduling

Schedule interviews for Market Managers and Supervisors.

Send calendar invites and confirmations.

Follow up 24 hours before interviews to reduce no-shows.



Onboarding Support

Collect required documents (I-9, Direct Deposit, Licenses, etc.).

Ensure new hire paperwork is complete before Day 1.

Maintain organized digital employee files.



System & Database Management

Update and maintain the Applicant Tracking System (ATS).

Properly tag candidates (Hired, Rejected, Future Interest).

Keep recruiting data clean and accurate.



What Success Looks Like:

Field roles filled within 7 days.

Daily sourcing targets consistently achieved.

At least 20% of screened candidates move to interview stage.

80%+ interview show-up rate.

100% complete and compliant new hire paperwork.



What We’re Really Looking For:

5+ years of high-volume recruiting or staffing experience.

Experience recruiting for landscaping, janitorial, construction, HVAC, pest control, or similar field roles is a plus.

Strong “hunter” mindset — you actively search and pursue candidates.

Comfortable cold-calling and texting applicants.

Experience using ATS systems, job boards, and scheduling tools.

Highly organized — able to manage 20+ open roles at once.

Strong follow-up skills — you don’t let candidates disappear.

About the Company



Allipse Marketing Management owns and operates multiple direct-to-consumer brands in the US market, primarily in health, beauty, and wellness. We build brands that solve real problems and scale through performance-driven marketing.



We’re now looking for a Direct Response Copywriter who knows how to write copy that converts — especially for static ads and paid traffic funnels.



About the Role



This role is for a copywriter who understands how ads actually work in performance marketing. You’ll be writing copy for static image ads,
 campaigns, VSLs, and landing pages — with a strong focus on messaging that stops the scroll and drives action.



You should understand how copy changes across cold, warm, and hot audiences, and how to brief designers so ideas translate clearly into high-performing creatives.



What You’ll Do



Write direct response copy for static image ads and paid social campaigns



Write ads across the full funnel (TOF, MOF, BOF) — from hooks to conversion-focused messaging



Develop hooks, headlines, primary text, and CTAs that drive clicks and sales



Create clear creative briefs so designers execute your ideas correctly



Apply concepts like awareness stages, customer avatars, and market sophistication



Use AI tools to speed up research, ideation, and variation testing



Review performance data and iterate on what’s working



What We’re Looking For



2+ years of experience writing direct response copy for DTC e-commerce



Strong understanding of hooks, objections, CTAs, and buyer psychology



Experience writing static ad copy, not just long-form content



Comfortable writing for US audiences



Confident using AI tools as part of your daily workflow



Agency or performance-marketing experience is a plus



Growth Path



Copywriter ? Senior Copywriter ? Lead Copywriter ? Creative Strategist



How to Apply



Please send:



Your resume / CV



3–5 samples of direct response copy (static ads, scripts, or landing pages)



A short note on one ad you think works well and why



Note: This role is not suitable for beginners.

title: Virtual Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
We are a growing outpatient psychiatric wellness practice seeking an experienced Virtual Registered Nurse (RN) to provide remote clinical and administrative support to our providers.



This role is ideal for a detail-oriented RN who is comfortable working independently, communicating professionally with patients, and supporting providers in a fast-paced clinical environment.



Key Responsibilities:

-Complete prior authorizations (PAs) for medications and treatments

-Prepare and process FMLA, disability, work/school, and patient letter requests on behalf of providers

-Respond to patient clinical questions and concerns within scope, escalating to providers as appropriate

-Manage and respond to prescription refill requests and medication-related patient messages

-Assist with clinical documentation and charting support when needed

-Support providers (multiple clinicians) with additional clinical or administrative tasks as needed



Requirements:

-Active Registered Nurse (RN) license

-Strong verbal and written English communication skills

-Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow provider-specific instructions

-Comfortable working remotely and maintaining strict patient confidentiality (HIPAA-compliant practices)



Preferred Experience:

-Prior experience in outpatient psychiatric settings strongly preferred

-Prior authorizations and insurance-related workflows with US based companies

-Familiarity with psychiatric medication workflows

-Experience supporting multiple providers simultaneously



Schedule & Growth:

-Available to work Monday - Friday from 9am to 6pm central time

-Opportunity for long-term collaboration and increased responsibilities over time



Please include a brief summary of your RN background and relevant virtual or outpatient experience when applying.

title: E-commerce Finance - Long Term 0 Part Time
description:
What are we looking for



We are looking for a Finance Manager.

In this role, you are responsible for our financial health and planning. You manage cashflow, forecast future performance, and help us make smart investment decisions. You give clear insights about margins, profit, and growth possibilities.



What We Offer (USP’s):



• Hourly rate: $10–$15 (depending on experience)

• 10-15 hours per week

• performance bonus

• We offer a stable long-term position with growth opportunities.



Our Story (About Us):



We are a fast-growing e-commerce company, mainly active on 
 (the #1 online marketplace in the Netherlands and Belgium). With our international team of 12+ members, we build and grow our own brands. We value structure, teamwork, and long-term partnerships. Our focus is on delivering high-quality products while supporting our team with clear processes and growth opportunities.



Your Responsibilities:



• Manage and monitor company cashflow

• Create monthly and quarterly financial forecasts

• Analyze profit margins and overall financial performance

• Advise if and when external financing or loans are needed

• Calculate how much we can safely invest in stock, marketing, and growth

• Prepare clear financial reports for management



What We Expect (Requirements/Experience):



• Reliable PC & strong internet connection

• 3+ years experience in finance, accounting, or financial planning

• Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills (forecasting & financial modeling)

• Experience with cashflow management and budgeting

• Understanding of profit margins, ROI, and investment analysis

• Experience in e-commerce or online business 

Experience with advising E-commerce sellers to Take out loan to take opportunity and To lower loans for better balance sheet.

And also with projecting future sales and basing cashflow on this projection





How to Apply:



Please answer the following questions:



What is your hourly rate?

Describe your experience with cashflow forecasting and financial planning.

Have you advised before on investments or taking loans? If yes, explain briefly.

title: Influencer & Social Media Marketing Specialist
description:
We run an e-commerce business in the herbal healing space, rooted in Traditional Chinese Medicine (a bonus if you're familiar). We are 100% Direct to Consumer (DTC) and largely a subscription-based business. 



Our Ambassador Program is a key growth channel, and we're looking for someone to lead outreach, management, and social engagement while providing community care through customer support.



Role Overview

This is a hybrid role focused primarily on ambassador management and social media engagement (70%) with customer experience support (30%). 

You'll report to the Head of Community Care and work closely with our CX Lead Agent and the broader CX team. 

You'll own the day-to-day ambassador relationships, social listening, content curation, and community engagement across Instagram and TikTok.



Primary Responsibilities: Ambassador Management & Social Media (70%)

Ambassador Outreach & Relationship Management

Source and recruit new ambassadors through proactive outreach on Instagram, TikTok, and other social platforms

Manage ambassador onboarding process and ongoing relationship nurturing

Process ambassador applications.

Track ambassador performance, content creation, and program engagement

Coordinate ambassador campaigns to drive additional conversions

Coordinate ambassador communications, including newsletter updates and program announcements

Request and organize raw b-roll content from ambassadors for internal content library

Monitor and report on ambassador-driven metrics and conversion performance



Social Media Engagement & Community Building

Reply to comments on our brand’s Instagram and TikTok accounts

Complete social engagement with ambassadors and niche creators in hormone health, TCM, period education, nervous system regulation, and holistic wellness across Instagram,
 groups, TikTok, Reddit

Leave thoughtful, specific comments on ambassador and relevant creator content (not generic engagement)

Build authentic relationships with emerging creators in our niche

Stay culturally relevant within the hormone health and TCM communities



Content Curation & Trend Research

Conduct weekly trending content research across TikTok and Instagram and identify trending videos/Reels weekly related to period symptoms, TCM, hormone healing, herbs, stress regulation, and related topics

Save content to organized collections and log links in tracking spreadsheet with analysis (hook, format, why it's trending)

Monitor daily social media tags, repost ambassador content to brand stories with branded backgrounds, and send personalized thank-you messages via DM

Download, organize, and archive all ambassador mentions, story tags, and weekly organic posts following established naming conventions and Drive folder structure



Secondary Responsibilities: Customer Experience (30%)

Respond to
, chat, or social media tickets from current and prospective customers, including:

Cancellation requests, website issues, shipping issues, order questions, product education

Follow Standard Operating Procedures when handling tickets

Escalate complex tickets to Lead Agent according to protocol

Process refunds, re-shipments, and other customer requests

Log product, fulfillment, and technology defects

Contribute customer insights during tea
etings





Additional Responsibilities

Support ad-hoc projects across Ops, Marketing, and Community Care teams

Maintain organized tracking systems for ambassador activities, social engagement, and customer interactions



The Ideal Candidate Will Have:

Required:

Exceptional English writing capabilities (understanding American terminology and expressions)

2+ years experience in influencer outreach, social media community management, or ambassador program coordination

Strong Instagram and TikTok native skills with ability to identify trends, spot emerging creators, and engage authentically

Highly organized with meticulous attention to detail

Experience with customer service handling
, chat, and SMS inbound tickets

Experience with Aspire, Shopify, Recharge, Gorgias, and Google Suite (especially Drive organization)

Comfort using AI tools (ChatGPT or other LLMs) to improve messaging and efficiency

Ability to work weekends (consistent schedule with start time between 8am-12pm EST, end time 5pm-9pm EST)

Self-starter mentality with ability to manage independent weekly tasks and proactively communicate status

Empathetic, warm communication style focused on building genuine relationships (not transactional engagement)

Eye for quality content and understanding of what makes posts replicable or scroll-stopping



Preferred:

Experience at an American DTC e-commerce startup in women's CPG, wellness, or healthcare

Prior experience managing or working with influencer/ambassador programs

Familiarity with Traditional Chinese Medicine, hormone health, or holistic wellness topics

Experience using content download tools and building organized content libraries

Experience with quiz platforms (Digioh, Pickzen, etc.)

Prior experience working with AI agents, escalating issues, and troubleshooting rules and knowledge bases

Personal interest in wellness, cycle health, or TCM



Next Steps

Please upload your resume and fill out this screening assessment: 
/to/vjnMl6uk to help us assess your interest in this role and how you handle various customer and ambassador scenarios. If it seems like a good fit, we'll reach out to schedule an interview. We'd love for someone to start by early March.

title: Billing & Collections Specialist
description:
We are seeking for a Specialist, Billing & Collections in the Property Care / Field Services industry.



We are looking for someone who will make sure the work completed by our field teams turns into accurate invoices — and that those invoices get paid on time.



In simple terms — your job is to send correct invoices quickly, follow up on unpaid accounts, and make sure money comes in without delays.



This is not just a data-entry role. You will own the billing process from start to finish.



What You’ll Really Be Doing:

Billing & Invoicing

Generate invoices for residential and commercial services (pest control, landscaping, janitorial, pool care, etc.).

Submit invoices through customer vendor portals (like VendorNet and others).

Ensure invoices are sent on time — many due on the 1st of the month or within 24 hours of job completion.

Double-check contract details (square footage, materials used, pricing) before sending invoices.



Vendor Portal Management

Upload required documents like W-9s and Certificates of Insurance (COIs).

Resolve invoice rejections quickly (within 24 hours).

Maintain compliance in customer portals to prevent payment delays.



Collections & Accounts Receivable

Monitor the AR Aging report daily.

Follow up on unpaid invoices via
 and phone.

Reduce overdue accounts and meet DSO targets.

Maintain professional but firm communication with customers.



Data Accuracy & Compliance

Keep customer billing data accurate and updated.

Work with Internal Ops to secure required documents for payment release.

Minimize billing errors and disputes.



Customer Support

Resolve billing questions and disputes quickly.

Act as the main contact for billing concerns while maintaining strong client relationships.



What Success Looks Like:

Invoices are sent on time — no delays.

95% of invoices are collected within payment terms.

AR over 60 days stays below 5%.

Billing disputes stay below 2%.

Vendor portal issues are resolved within 24 hours.



What We’re Really Looking For:

5+ years of experience in billing, accounts receivable, or revenue cycle management.

Experience in service-based industries (facility services, property services, etc.) is a plus.

Comfortable working with vendor portals and ERP systems.

Strong attention to detail and accuracy.

Confident following up on unpaid invoices — you are not afraid to pick up the phone.

Strong understanding of contracts, tax rates, and billing calculations.

Organized and able to manage multiple accounts at once.

Results-driven and motivated by hitting collection targets.



Requirements:

Updated Resume/CV.

Reliable internet connection and personal computer.

Ability to work in a deadline-driven environment.

Able to work in U.S hour



Benefits:

Competitive salary based on experience.

HMO for you and your dependents

PTO and paid holidays.

Remote work flexibility.

Opportunity to grow in a performance-focused accounting team.



Join our team now and be part of the top 1% talent in the Philippines!

title: HubSpot CRM & Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
We’re a fast-growing U.S.-based company looking for a highly experienced HubSpot Automation & Integrations Specialist who truly understands HubSpot at a deep, systems level.



???? This is NOT a training role.

? This is a hands-on, high-level position for someone who can take ownership immediately and improve our systems from day one.



Our main focus:

You must have extensive knowledge of HubSpot and integrations.



If you do not confidently rate yourself at least 7.5/10 in HubSpot, you should still be the type of professional who is proactive, resourceful, and fully confident in your ability to research, test, and master anything needed to exceed expectations.



We are not looking for someone who has “used HubSpot.”

We are looking for someone who understands how it works under the hood.



If you can build, optimize, fix, and integrate HubSpot without hand-holding, we want 



What You’ll Be Responsible For

HubSpot Automation & CRM Management

• Build advanced custom HubSpot workflows for lead routing, onboarding, follow-ups, and marketing automation

• Audit, troubleshoot, and repair broken or inefficient workflows

• Optimize Marketing, Sales, and Operations Hub processes for scalability

• Manage and refine pipelines, deal stages, lifecycle stages, and automation rules

• Set up task automation, sequences, contact scoring, smart lists, and segmentation

• Improve data structure and ensure CRM integrity



Integrations & Systems Management (Major Focus)

• Integrate HubSpot with third-party tools such as: Zapier / Google Sheets / Calendly /
 platforms / Other CRMs / Marketing tools

• Troubleshoot sync issues, API-related challenges, automation failures, and data inconsistencies

• Create internal alerts, notifications, and operational automations

• Ensure clean, reliable data flow between systems

• Proactively recommend better system architecture when needed



Copy & Marketing Logic (Support Role)

• Support
 sequences and automation copy when required

• Understand funnel logic, lifecycle stages, and campaign strategy

• Ensure automation aligns with marketing and sales goals



Must-Have Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



• Extensive hands-on experience with HubSpot (Marketing, Sales, and/or Operations Hub)

• Minimum 2+ years managing complex workflows and CRM systems

• Strong experience with HubSpot integrations and third-party tool connections

• Proven ability to audit, fix, and optimize broken automations

• Deep understanding of:

Lead lifecycle management

Segmentation and list logic

Automation triggers and enrollment rules

Data structure and CRM best practices

• Highly proactive and solution-oriented

• Comfortable figuring things out independently without waiting for instructions

• Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken)



You should be confident enough in HubSpot that if something new is required, you know you can learn it quickly and execute at a high level.



Bonus Points If You

• Have supported U.S.-based companies

• Have strong experience with Zapier troubleshooting and CRM sync fixes

• Think in systems and processes (not just tasks)

• Proactively suggest improvements instead of waiting to be told what to do

• Have experience improving reporting accuracy and automation efficiency



Work Schedule & Setup



• Full-time: 40 hours per week

• 100% Work From Home

• Must have some overlap with U.S. Eastern Time business hours



Compensation & Growth



• Monthly Salary: USD $660 – $1,500 (Full-Time), depending on experience

• Competitive PHP-based compensation

• Performance-based bonuses

• Long-term role with room for growth and increased responsibility



Please DO NOT Apply If



• You need training on how HubSpot works

• You have only used HubSpot for basic
 marketing or contact management

• You are not comfortable troubleshooting integrations

• You wait for instructions instead of solving problems



How to Apply



To apply, please submit:



Your CV

Examples or screenshots of HubSpot workflows/automations you’ve built

A short 1–2 minute intro video explaining:

Your HubSpot experience

Your confidence level (rate yourself 1–10)

A workflow or integration you are most proud of

 Subject Line:

“HubSpot Automation Specialist – [Your Name]”



We are looking for someone who thinks like a systems architect, executes like an operator, and improves everything they touch.



If that’s you — apply now and show us what you can do.

title: Bilingual (Spanish/English) - Virtual Admin Assistant
description:
I’m looking for a highly organized and proactive bilingual Administrative Assistant (Spanish/English) to support high-volume scheduling, communication, and coordination across multiple offices. 



This is an execution-focused role that requires strong calendar management skills, confidence handling inbound and outbound calls, and the ability to keep day-to-day operations running smoothly while delivering a positive experience for both clients and employees.



What you’ll do:



- Manage and schedule client appointments to maintain full and optimized caseloads

- Answer, screen, and handle inbound and outbound calls professionally and efficiently

- Provide administrative coverage and scheduling support for multiple offices

- Coordinate with clinical staff, operations, and internal teams to ensure smooth service delivery

- Maintain accurate calendars and scheduling records using Google Calendar, Docs, and Sheets

- Use CentralReach and CRM systems to manage client data, appointments, and communication

- Apply ABA and Speech Therapy (ST) scheduling requirements, including session types and provider availability

- Proactively resolve scheduling conflicts, cancellations, and last-minute changes

- Ensure clear communication and reliable support for both clients and staff



What I’m looking for:



- Professional proficiency in both Spanish and English

- Experience as an Administrative Assistant, Scheduling Coordinator, or in a call center environment

- Strong understanding of ABA and Speech Therapy scheduling workflows

- Hands-on experience with CentralReach and CRM systems

- Proficiency in Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendars)

- Excellent organization, attention to detail, and accuracy

- Ability to manage high call volumes and multiple schedules simultaneously

- Comfortable working with multiple teams and adapting to changing priorities



Schedule:



- Full-time, 40 hours per week

- Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM PST



Apply here:

title: Youtube Video Editor
description:
Vending Accelerator™ is not a vending machine brand.



We are the category creator of High-Traffic Location Mastery™ — a system that helps professionals build six-figure vending businesses using 2–3 high-traffic locations instead of 30+ machines



We are growing quickly.



We publish:

* 1 long-form YouTube video per week

* Multiple YouTube Shorts weekly

* Instagram +
 Reels

* We are looking for a high-speed, high-standard video editor who can help us scale without sacrificing quality.



This is not an influencer channel.



This is a category-defining brand built on:

* Proof

* Precision

* Authority

* Real client results

* Psychology-driven positioning



We do not use hype edits.



We do not use flashy gimmicks.



We do not overproduce.



Our style is:

* Clean

* Sharp

* Intentional

* Strategic

* Conversion-aware



If you specialize in loud thumbnails, 
 edits, or dopamine-heavy cuts — this is not the role.



If you understand pacing, tension, authority, and clarity — keep reading.



* Editing 1 long-form YouTube video per week (10–25 minutes)

* Turning that long-form into 5–10 Shorts

* Delivering vertical versions formatted for IG + FB

* Clean captioning (no clutter)

* Strategic pacing to improve retention

* Simple but strong hook emphasis in first 5–10 seconds

* Quick turnaround (24-48 hours preferred for long-form)



You must:

* Understand retention editing

* Know how to cut dead space without killing authority

* Add subtle motion, zooms, framing adjustments

* Keep energy high without being obnoxious

* Deliver on time, every time

* Be responsive and coachable

* Think strategically, not just technically

* Speed with accuracy

* Clean file organization

* Ownership mentality

* Long-term partnership mindset

* Ability to take feedback without ego

* Experience editing education or business content

* Understanding of YouTube analytics

* Thumbnail collaboration ability

* Ability to suggest hook improvements



Ryan is the founder of Vending Accelerator™ and FREE Healthy Vending™ — a dual ecosystem serving 250,000+ students and tens of thousands of consumers nationwide.



His clients have generated over $20M+ in revenue across 2024–2025.



We are not experimenting.



We are scaling a proven system.



Send:

* Portfolio (long-form + shorts)

title: Medical Care Coordinator
description:

We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Care coordinator to join our remote team. patients, ensuring continuity of care and timely completion of visits.

title: Social Media Video Editor
description:
The Vibe:

We are KasoLead a. premium B2B marketing agency that has served 120+ clients across Scandinavia and the US. 



Our content doesn't look like a corporate agency. It looks like it belongs on your feed, stops the scroll, and closes deals.

We make ads that convert.



YouTube videos that build authority, and organic content that actually gets watched.



The Role:

We're looking for a Master Editor. Someone who treats the timeline like a weapon. You don't just cut clips together. You understand why a cut lands, when a 
 makes someone trust a brand more, and how pacing can make someone feel something before they even realize it.



What You'll Do:

Edit Video ads, organic short-form content, and long-form YouTube videos, sometimes all three in the same week.



You'll know when something should feel premium and polished, and when it should feel raw and punchy like a 
 that belongs on the internet. You'll use AI tools (Runway, Veo, whatever works) to generate B-roll when you need to go the extra mile, not as a shortcut, but as a craft tool. You'll bring persuasion into every edit, knowing that emotion drives action.



You Are:

Someone who eats, sleeps, and breathes editing. You understand virality and you understand conversion, and you know they're not opposites. You have a sharp aesthetic eye. 



You can switch between "this needs to feel like a $50k ad campaign" and "this needs to feel like a funny video a friend sent you" without missing a beat. You're resourceful. If you can't find the right clip, you make it. You're committed. You don't disappear, you deliver.



Requirements:

Proficient in whatever editing software you have. Strong portfolio showing both short-form and long-form work. 



Can edit videos in the Swedish or Norwegian language besides English, with a proper script or by pasting down the script from software like WisperFlow to see the captions.



How to Apply:

Send your portfolio to 
 or message.



Highlight 1–2 videos where you felt the editing itself carried the emotion or the story, not just the script.



THE TEST: We send you a dry talking-head clip. No music. No B-roll. Nothing. How do you make it really really good and worth watching? Tell us your approach in 3–5 sentences.



Start your message with "KASO EDITOR" so we know you actually read this.

title: Accountant & Bookkeeper
description:
From Day One’s Accountant/Bookkeeper will be responsible for managing and processing financial transactions of our conference and media company as well as assisting with general financial, data, operational, and analytical projects.



You will be use QuickBooks to classify transactions, and will create and maintain internal and managerial reports on business aspects of our operations. You’ll also work closely with our finance team, staff members, vendors, and clients to ensure accurate financial records and compliance with accounting standards.



In addition, this role will involve support for a broad set of operational and transactional processes within the company, including compliance, management, human resources, and other reporting and tracking processes.



This position requires a high degree of self-motivation, strong project management and organizational skills, facility with QuickBooks and Microsoft XL, and a willingness to master the other software platforms we use. You should be able to shift efficiently between disparate tasks and to work under pressure. You should also have excellent remote-work skills, interpersonal skills, and written and verbal communication skills.



REQUIREMENTS



• Must be available for a video interview, consisting of verbal questions and a skills test

• Must own a working laptop of a recent model and have full access to wifi of sufficient speed

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field

• Minimum 3 years’ experience as a bookkeeper or similar role

• Proficiency in accounting software, especially QuickBooks Online

• Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices

• Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

• Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced remote environment

• Effective communication and interpersonal skills



SCHEDULE AND COMPENSATION



• The position is virtual. We are headquartered in Brooklyn, New York, and our main team works 9am-5pm Eastern Standard Time. Your schedule will require some overlap with U.S. hours.

• Estimated working hours: 40 hours per week

• This position will start with a weekly project. Upon successful completion of that initial assignment, you’ll transition to a monthly salary ($1000/month, plus an annual bonus).



RESPONSIBILITIES:



1. Accounts Payable

• Process invoices and ensure timely payments to vendors and suppliers

• Verify expenses, reconcile accounts, and resolve any discrepancies

• Maintain vendor files and communicate effectively with vendors regarding payment inquiries



2. Accounts Receivable

• Process invoices and ensure timely payments to vendors and suppliers

• Verify expenses, reconcile accounts, and resolve any discrepancies

• Maintain vendor files and communicate effectively with vendors regarding payment inquiries



3. Bank Reconciliation

• Process invoices and ensure timely payments to vendors and suppliers

• Verify expenses, reconcile accounts, and resolve any discrepancies

• Maintain vendor files and communicate effectively with vendors regarding payment inquiries



4. Financial Reporting

• Process invoices and ensure timely payments to vendors and suppliers

• Verify expenses, reconcile accounts, and resolve any discrepancies

• Maintain vendor files and communicate effectively with vendors regarding payment inquiries



5. Payroll Processing

• Process payroll for employees, including salary and bonuses

• Ensure compliance with payroll taxes, deductions, and reporting requirements

• Maintain accurate payroll records and provide support for any payroll-related inquiries



6. General Accounting Support

• Assist with budgeting and forecasting processes

• Coordinate with external auditors during financial audits

• Stay informed about changes in accounting regulations and ensure compliance

title: Customer Service Representative
description:

mbers are accountable for fulfilling this.

8 hours per day, 5 days per week. Your 2 days off will be discussed with your manager, and if you have a preference for certain days, we will try to accommodate it.



The 6th day of work per week is optional (not mandatory), depending on business needs, and counts as paid overtime.

This role starts ASAP.



As a Customer Service Representative at Five Star Retail Brands, a typical day will include the following:

s, live chat, and text messages

mbers and report to the superiors

s

What we can offer:

title: Outbound Cold Caller — Boutique M&A Advisory Firm
description:
About the Role

Windsor Drake is a boutique investment banking advisory firm advising founders on the sale of companies valued between $3M and $50M. We work with private equity firms, strategic acquirers, and family offices across North America.

We are hiring an Outbound Cold Caller to support our deal origination and buyer outreach efforts. You will be calling business owners, CEOs, private equity professionals, and corporate development executives on behalf of senior bankers.

This role requires flawless American English with absolutely no detectable accent. You will be speaking with highly sophisticated business professionals who will immediately disengage if anything sounds off. This is non-negotiable — do not apply unless you are genuinely confident you sound American on the phone.



Responsibilities



Make 80-120+ outbound calls per day to targeted prospects from prepared lists

Deliver scripted and semi-scripted openers, then navigate live conversations naturally

Book qualified meetings and discovery calls for senior tea
mbers

Log all call activity, outcomes, and notes in HubSpot CRM

Follow up with prospects who requested callbacks or expressed interest

Handle objections professionally and know when to push and when to move on

Collaborate with the outreach team to refine scripts and improve conversion rates

Maintain a professional, authoritative tone on every call — you represent an investment bank, not a call center





Requirements



Native-level American English with zero accent — voice sample required with application

1+ year experience in outbound cold calling, SDR/BDR, or telemarketing serving US/Canadian markets

Comfortable making high-volume calls and handling rejection daily

Strong ability to think on your feet — real conversations, not robotic script reading

Professional and confident phone presence — calm, authoritative, peer-to-peer tone

Experience with CRM tools (HubSpot preferred)

Reliable internet, quality headset, and a completely quiet workspace

Available to work US Eastern hours consistently





Preferred but Not Required



Experience calling into financial services, private equity, or C-suite executives

Familiarity with M&A, business brokerage, or B2B professional services

Experience with Apollo, Instantly, or similar outreach tools





What Success Looks Like



Consistently booking 8-15+ qualified meetings per week

Prospects assume you are calling from a New York or Toronto office

Clean CRM hygiene with detailed call notes

Steady improvement in conversion rates over time





How to Apply

Submit the following:



Your resume

A 60-second voice recording of yourself reading the script below — one take, quiet room, no coaching:



"Hi, this is [Your Name] calling from Windsor Drake. We're a mergers and acquisitions advisory firm, and I'm reaching out because we're currently working with a company in your space that may be a strong strategic fit. I know I'm catching you out of the blue — do you have about two minutes, or should I send over a brief summary by
?"



A second 30-second recording of you answering this question off the cuff — no script, just talk naturally:



"Tell me about the last cold calling role you had. What were you selling, and what was your daily volume?"



A short note on why you are a strong fit for this role



Applications missing either voice recording will not be reviewed.

title: $1,200/month to manage $50K+ in ad spend across 12 countries — with a clear path to Head of Growth
description:
We're a fast-scaling e-commerce brand in the pet niche, operating across 12+ European markets. Our business runs on two models: 70% COD (Cash on Delivery) and 30% dropshipping. We manage multiple products, multiple funnels, and multiple countries — all at once.

We're currently in aggressive expansion mode with a 3-year objective of $100M/year in revenue. We need ONE strategic Media Buyer to join the core team and grow with us long-term. 

This is NOT a "check ROAS and increase budgets" role since it's easily automated with AI. We need someone who thinks like a entrepreneur and have a strong overall comprehensive of the e-commerce business. 



To apply: 



???? WHAT YOU'LL DO



Launch, monitor, and optimize Meta ad campaigns across 12+ European markets for multiple products

Make kill / scale / reborn decisions based on ROAS, spend data, CPM context, and your own judgment

Manage budgets across COD and dropshipping models — each has different KPIs and constraints

Produce daily performance reports with clear hypotheses explaining WHY results look the way they do

Check stock levels before scaling any COD market — in COD, you maximize ROI on inventory, not just ROI on spend

Identify patterns across markets and flag issues beyond ads: broken pages, bad translations, weak offers, stock shortages

Understand the full funnel: offers, advertorials, landing pages, product pages, checkout flows

Optimize spend allocation — push budget where the returns are highest, cut fast where they're not



???? WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Must-Have:



1-2+ years of hands-on Meta Ads media buying experience (agency or in-house e-commerce)

Experience with COD and/or dropshipping models

Strong analytical thinking — you look at a dashboard and tell a story, not just read numbers

Comfortable managing campaigns across multiple countries simultaneously

Proactive communicator — you flag issues, propose solutions, and share insights daily without being asked

Fluent English (written reports and async communication)

Available 6 days/week, including Sundays (Monday off)



Nice-to-Have:



Experience in the pet niche or health/wellness e-commerce

Familiarity with European COD markets (Southern & Eastern Europe)

Knowledge of Shopify, funnel building, or CRO

Understanding of creative strategy and ad angle testing



???? WHAT WE OFFER



$800 - $1,200/month based on experience and proven results

Full-time remote position — we value results, not hours clocked

Direct path to Head of Growth as the company scales toward $100M/year

Real impact — you directly influence strategy, revenue, and company direction

Long-term commitment — we're building a core team for the next 5-10 years, not hiring for a project

Work on a fast-growing brand with real products, real customers, and real scale across 12+ countries



???? THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF...



You only know how to toggle budgets up and down based on ROAS

You can't explain WHY a campaign is performing the way it is

You're not comfortable working across multiple markets with different dynamics

You treat media buying as a 9-to-5 task instead of a strategic function

You're looking for a short-term gig



???? HOW TO APPLY

The form includes real scenarios we face daily. It takes 20-30 minutes to complete properly. We read every single application — if you're the right fit, we'll reach out within 3 business days.

We don't hire for skills alone — we hire for thinking.

Important: If you've read this far, congratulations — you've passed the first test. To confirm you read this entire post, when asked for your age, enter "6". Applications without this will not be reviewed.



Fill out our application form here:

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 2a
description:
APPLY ON MY WEBSITE TO BE CONSIDERED: 


/cro-shopify-web-developer/



CRO Shopify Web Developer – Job Overview

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.



Note: All Remote Employees Must Be Available To Work During The Following Business Hours:

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Develop landing pages using Figma and various WYSYWIG editors including but not limited to Replo and Pagefly.

- Edit product, collection and other page templates using Shopify Liquid template engine, and various HTML/CSS frameworks.

- Install various checkout/tracking applications (aftersell, Zipify OCU, Upstack, etc)

- Install various applications for product bundling when needed, and create product bundles. 

- Install tracking pixels on client’s websites

- Implement A/B tests in intelligems for product price tests, shipping price tests, theme tests, landing page tests, and more.

title: Graphic Designer/Video Editor
description:
We are looking for a creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer to join our team! The ideal candidate will specialize in print design — including business cards, brochures, flyers, posters, and large-format materials such as banners and signage.



You’ll be working directly with different clients to bring their ideas to life, ensuring that every design meets both aesthetic and technical print standards. Strong communication skills, reliability, and the ability to stay highly productive during graveyard working hours are essential for this role.



*Key Responsibilities*



• Design and prepare print-ready layouts for various materials: business cards, brochures, flyers, tarpaulins, banners, and other large-format prints.

•Communicate directly with clients to understand their design needs and brand guidelines.

•Collaborate with the production team to ensure color accuracy, print quality, and technical feasibility.

•Manage multiple projects and deadlines while maintaining high design standards.

•Review proofs and samples to ensure precision before printing.

•Stay updated with design trends, printing techniques, and materials.

•Maintain consistent reliability and high productivity throughout the graveyard shift.



*Qualifications*



•Proven experience as a Graphic Designer with a strong portfolio focused on print materials.

•Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) or equivalent tools.

•Excellent English communication skills — both written and verbal.

•Confident and comfortable in client-facing discussions.

•Highly detail-oriented — an absolute must for print work.

•Strong sense of layout, color, and typography.

•Ability to manage time effectively and meet deadlines.

•Familiarity with print production processes and specifications (bleed, resolution, CMYK, etc.).

•Knowledge of large-format printing is an advantage.

•Willingness to work the graveyard shift, demonstrating dependability and the ability to maintain exceptional performance during these hours.

title: Customer Support Representative (Shopify) — Full-Time (Remote, Freelance)
description:
Important: This is a full-time, long-term role, not a gig or side project. We are seeking someone who will work only with our company and not manage other clients.



About the role



We’re hiring a full-time Customer Support Representative to support customers on our Shopify store. You’ll handle customer inquiries, resolve order-related issues, and ensure a smooth experience from purchase to delivery.



Working hours

 • Schedule: Monday to Saturday

 • Hours: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM

 • Type: Full-time, remote (freelance/contract)



Key responsibilities

 • Respond to customer inquiries via chat,
, and/or phone in a timely and professional manner

 • Support customers with order status, shipping, returns/exchanges, refunds, and product questions

 • Manage orders in Shopify (updates, cancellations, address changes, refunds, etc.)

 • Troubleshoot common issues (checkout problems, discount codes, account/login support)

 • Escalate complex cases to the relevant team and follow up until resolution

 • Maintain accurate customer records and notes in the support system/CRM

 • Suggest improvements to FAQs, templates, and workflows based on recurring issues



Requirements

 • Customer support experience (e-commerce experience)

 • Familiarity with Shopify (or willingness to learn quickly)

 • Strong written and verbal communication skills

 • Customer-first mindset and problem-solving ability

 • Reliable availability Monday–Saturday, 10:00 AM–6:00 PM

 • Stable internet connection



Company benefits

 • Opportunities to work in a fast-growing environment with room to develop and grow

 • Paid time off (PTO) accrual: You earn paid vacation days gradually throughout the year. Accrued days can be used for planned leave, subject to coverage.

 • Paid day off on your birthday

 • Performance-based end-of-year bonus based on results and consistency



Additional benefits

 • Work from anywhere (fully remote)

 • Clear onboarding and SOPs to help you ramp up quickly

 • Access to required tools/software needed to do the job (where applicable)

 • Growth opportunities

 • Regular feedback and performance check-ins with clear targets for bonus eligibility



How to apply



Send your CV/resume and a short note describing your Shopify or e-commerce support experience (channels handled, tools used, and typical ticket volume).

title: Senior Tax Return Preparer (Part-Time, Year-Round)
description:
Senior U.S. Tax Return Preparer (Part-Time, Year-Round)



A U.S.-based tax firm is seeking an experienced Senior U.S. Tax Return Preparer to support individual and business tax preparation on a part-time, year-round basis.



This role is intended for a seasoned tax professional who can prepare returns independently, handle routine client communication, and work during U.S. business hours.



Key Responsibilities

• Prepare U.S. individual income tax returns (Form 1040) and related schedules

• Prepare U.S. business tax returns, including:

o Form 1120-S (S Corporations)

o Form 1120 (C Corporations)

o Form 1065 (Partnerships)

• Handle routine client communication, including follow-ups, document requests, and basic tax questions

• Ensure accuracy and compliance with current U.S. IRS regulations

• Follow firm workflows, documentation standards, and deadlines



Required Qualifications

• 3+ years of U.S. tax return preparation experience

• Strong experience with Forms 1040, 1120-S, 1120, and 1065

• Hands-on experience with CCH Axcess Tax (required — no training provided)

• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

• Strong attention to detail and professional written communication skills



Workload & Hours (Important)

• Year-round, part-time role with variable hours

• Typical range: approximately 5–25 hours per week

o Fewer hours outside tax season

o Increased hours during tax season (approximately February–April)

• Candidates must be comfortable with fluctuating weekly workload



Availability & Compensation

• Ability to work during U.S. Eastern Time business hours

• Please include your hourly rate in your application

• Please confirm your weekly availability, especially during tax season



Position Details

• Fully remote

• Part-time, year-round

• Long-term opportunity as the firm continues to grow



How to Apply:

Please
 the following all together to: 



Please include all of the following with your application:

1. Resume

2. A brief self-introduction video (2–3 minutes preferred)

3. Your hourly rate

4. A summary of your tax return preparation experience, including the types of returns you prepare (1040, 1120-S, 1120, 1065)

5. Your experience with CCH Axcess Tax (years used, level of responsibility)



Applications missing any of the above information may not be reviewed.

title: Creative Strategist / Media Buyer Dropshipping/Ecommerce
description:
Creative Strategist / Media Buyer

(Dropshipping | Beauty & Health | Meta Ads | Direct Response)



We’re a high-volume dropshipping business in the Beauty & Health niche, scaling aggressively through Meta Ads and direct-response marketing.

We turn cold traffic into buyers using data-driven creatives and structured media buying. Now we’re looking for a true A-player who can own both creative performance and media buying execution.

Someone who has managed $10K+/day in ad spend, understands how to scale cold traffic profitably, and knows exactly how creative and media buying work together to drive ROAS.

This is not a beginner's role.

This is for someone who’s been in the trenches and knows how to win.



What You’ll Do

Creative Strategy

- Analyze ad performance and identify winning creative patterns

- Develop and test new ads based on data & strategy

- Brief and direct the design team daily with clear, performance-focused feedback

- Continuously optimize hooks, messaging, and visuals to improve CTR, CVR & ROAS

- Turn raw data into clear creative direction



Media Buying

- Manage and scale Meta cold traffic campaigns

- Optimize budgets, structures, and bids to protect and scale ROAS

- Kill losing ads fast and scale winners with maintanance

- Manage testing frameworks and scaling strategies

-  Monitor real ROAS (not just platfor
trics) and make decisions accordingly

You’ll be inside Ads Manager daily — but also thinking strategically about why ads win or lose.



What You Bring

- Proven experience managing $10K+/day Meta ad accounts

- Strong understanding of direct-response marketing & buyer psychology

- Deep knowledge of Meta Ads structures, scaling strategies, and testing frameworks

- Analytical mindset — you think in numbers, patterns, and outcomes

- Experience in the Beauty & Health niche.

- Ownership, of your role in the business and expansion.

- Fully up to date with the latest Meta Ads updates and changes

- Ability to connect creative performance with media buying decisions



You understand that:

Creative drives performance

Structure protects profit

Data d
 everything



What You Get

- Up to $15 per hour (based on skill & experience)

- Huge growth potential in compensation and responsibility

- Work with a fast-moving, results-obsessed team

- Full ownership over creative strategy and ad performance

- Direct impact on scaling winning products internationally



?? Working Hours (Very Important)

This role requires you to be available daily at midnight UK time to execute media buying.

After the media buying session, you will continue with creative analysis and briefing the design team.



It is essential that you:

- Can consistently work during midnight UK timezone

- Are fully available for us full-time

- Are not juggling multiple full-time roles

- Can commit long-term

If these hours do not work for you, this role is not a fit.



If you’ve managed serious budgets, understand cold traffic at scale, and know how to build and scale creatives that convert — this is your opportunity to take full control of performance in a fast-growing dropshipping business.



Apply now — let’s scale together ????

title: Senior Accountant / Accounting Manager
description:
About Us

We are a growing finance and accounting firm providing outsourced CFO, accounting, and financial management services to high-growth companies. Our clients operate across various industries, including technology, e-commerce, and professional services. We leverage modern financial tools like QuickBooks Online, Ramp, and Gusto to deliver efficient, scalable solutions.



Job Description

We are seeking a Senior Accountant / Accounting Manager to manage client financial operations, ensuring accurate financial reporting, compliance, and strategic financial guidance. This role requires a strong accounting background, attention to detail, and experience with cloud-based accounting systems.



Key Responsibilities

Perform monthly account reconciliations and bookkeeping using QuickBooks Online.

Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports (Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Cash Flow).

Manage accounts payable (AP) and accounts receivable (AR), including invoicing, payment processing, and collections.

Oversee intercompany transactions and multi-entity accounting structures.

Handle payroll processing and tax filings through Gusto.

Support sales and use tax reporting, working with external service providers as needed.

Assist with corporate legal entity management, ensuring compliance with state and federal regulations.

Provide CFO-level strategic support, including financial planning, budgeting, and document review.

Lead risk management efforts, including state and federal compliance and insurance tracking.

Oversee treasury management, optimizing cash flow and banking relationships.

Support tax strategy and reporting in collaboration with tax advisors.

Manage capital table reporting and ensure accurate equity tracking.

Prepare custom financial reports as needed by clients.



Qualifications & Skills

5+ years of accounting experience, preferably in a client-facing role or outsourced accounting firm.

Strong experience with QuickBooks Online (certification is a plus).

Experience using Ramp for expense management and Gusto for payroll processing.

Proficiency in GAAP accounting principles and multi-entity consolidations.

Strong understanding of accounts payable, accounts receivable, and payroll functions.

Knowledge of sales tax and corporate tax reporting processes.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication skills for interacting with clients and stakeholders.

Ability to work independently in a remote environment with strong time management skills.

Preferred Qualifications

CPA or CMA certification preferred but not required.

Experience working in a high-growth startup or tech company.

Background in e-commerce or SaaS accounting.

Exposure to financial modeling and forecasting.



What We Offer

Remote work flexibility with a supportive, collaborative team.

Opportunity for career growth in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Access to cutting-edge financial tools and automation to streamline workflows.

title: Remote B2B Business Development Representative
description:
We’re looking for a motivated and results-driven Business Development Representative to help grow our sales pipeline and expand our customer base. As a BDR, you’ll be on the front lines of our sales efforts, identifying potential clients, generating leads, and nurturing opportunities to connect them with our solutions.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Proactively research and identify potential customers in target markets.

2. Reach out to prospects via
s, LinkedIn, and other communication channels.

3. Qualify leads to assess fit and interest, ensuring alignment with our services.

4. Schedule meetings or product demos between qualified leads and Sales Development Representatives.

5. Maintain accurate records of lead interactions and update CRM systems accordingly.

6. Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to execute campaigns and optimize lead generation strategies.

7. Stay up-to-date on industry trends and our product/service offerings to effectively communicate value propositions.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

- 2 - 3 years of experience in sales, business development, or a similar role (entry-level candidates with strong communication skills and a hunger to learn are also encouraged to apply).

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport quickly.

- Self-motivated, goal-oriented, and eager to exceed targets.

- Proficiency in extracting data from LinkedIn Sales Navigator and other professional networks

- Must have a well-optimized LinkedIn account with atleast a minimum of 300 connections that can be used for prospecting

- Familiarity with CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, PipeDrive) is a plus.

- Comfortable with cold outreach and prospecting.



Who we are:

Acadium started with the belief that anyone, anywhere, should be able to get the skills and experience they need to start their career without barriers like price, schedule, or location getting in their way. Acadium gives anyone the tools, support, and mentorship they need to launch their dream career. Acadium is the only platform that provides real work experience, accessible to everyone. Acadium began in 2017 with a team of 3 co-founders: Richard Shaw, Marco Tundo, and Moe Abbas. Since then, they’ve attracted more than 120,000 student members and over 50,000 businesses to connect through the apprenticeship marketplace. Our team is growing and looking for people who are motivated, intelligent, and committed to making education accessible to join our team.



What we value:

Integrity - Be trustworthy in your actions

Care - Treat your teammates and our community as you would want to be treated

Curiosity - Ask questions. Always state your assumptions

Tenacity - Persevere when times are tough

Discipline - Be consistent in your actions

Ambition - Aspire to become better every day

Service -Serve your community to the best of your abilities.



Interested applicants may send updated CVs and LinkedIn URLs to the contact person's
 address indicated below

 Subject: Business Development Representative

**Note: Only applicants who submit their resumes and LinkedIn links to 
 will be evaluated.

title: Accountant / CPA
description:
We operate a U.S.-based intermodal trucking company with both company drivers and owner-operators.



We are looking for an experienced virtual accountant to analyze revenue, costs, and true profit per load, so ownership can clearly understand which side of the business is more profitable.



???? This is NOT a full-time role

???? This is a weekly reporting position



What You’ll Be Responsible For

You will receive:



Company driver settlements



Owner-operator settlements



Agency / franchise settlements (US1)



Load-level revenue and expense data



Your responsibility is to categorize, calculate, and report profitability per load and per driver.



Scope of Work

1. Company Driver Loads (11 company trucks)

For each load, you will track:



Total load revenue



Fuel cost per load



Toll costs per load



Yard space cost (daily allocation)



Tolls per driver (daily allocation)



Any other direct operating costs



You will calculate:



Net profit per load



Net profit per driver



Total company-driver profitability (weekly)



2. Owner-Operator Loads

For each load, you will track:



Total load revenue



Amount paid to the owner-operator



Amount paid to the franchise/agency (US1)



Net amount retained by our company



You will calculate:



Profit per owner-operator load



Total owner-operator profitability (weekly)



3. Weekly Reports (Critical)

Data provided every Monday



Reports due every Wednesday



Reports must clearly show:



Company driver profit vs owner-operator profit



Profit per load



Profit per driver



Bottom-line comparison of both business models



Current Operation Size

41 drivers total



Mix of company drivers and owner-operators



U.S.-based freight operations



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Accounting or CPA background (Philippines-based OK)



Experience with trucking / transportation / logistics accounting (preferred)



Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills



Comfortable with cost allocation and profitability analysis



Able to meet weekly deadlines without reminders



Strong written English



Work Schedule & Pay

Part-time / weekly work



Ongoing role



Pay based on experience (please include your expected rate)



To Apply (Important)

Please answer the following questions in your application:



Describe your accounting experience related to trucking, logistics, or cost-based businesses



Explain how you would calculate true profit per load



What accounting tools or software have you used?



Can you consistently meet a Monday–Wednesday weekly turnaround?

Executive Assistance (60%)

title: Azure DevOps Engineer – Cloud Automation & CI/CD (FINTECH) | Remote
description:
Azure DevOps Engineer (Azure | CI/CD | Automation)



Remote | Canadian FINTECH | High-Impact Role



Build. Automate. Secure. Scale.

L’EVATE Inc., on behalf of a leading Canadian FINTECH innovator, is looking for a senior Azure DevOps Engineer who thrives in cloud-native, automation-first environments and wants to work on mission-critical financial platforms—100% remotely.



If you are passionate about CI/CD excellence, Infrastructure as Code, and secure DevOps at scale, this role gives you the opportunity to shape modern fintech systems used by real customers, not proof-of-concepts.



Why This Role Is Exciting



Own end-to-end DevOps pipelines powering production fintech platforms

Work with modern Azure PaaS and AKS architectures

Be a DevOps leader, not just a ticket closer

Collaborate with senior engineers in an agile, engineering-driven culture

Deliver real impact, not maintenance work



What You’ll Be Doing

CI/CD & Automation Excellence



Design, build, and optimize robust CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or similar

Automate build, test, deployment, monitoring, and rollback strategies

Ensure environment consistency through pipeline-driven releases



Azure Infrastructure & IaC



Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code using Bicep, ARM, or Terraform

Automate provisioning and management of:

App Services, Azure Functions, AKS

Key Vault, Application Gateway, Azure SQL

Enforce cloud governance, cost controls, tagging, and policies



Security, Compliance & Reliability



Embed security by design into pipelines (secrets management, scanning, code analysis)

Ensure compliance with ISO, SOC2, and OWASP standards

Manage access via RBAC, Managed Identities, and Azure AD



Monitoring & I
 Response



Implement proactive monitoring with Azure Monitor, Application Insights, and Log Analytics

Build alerting strategies to detect issues before users do

Support i
 response, RCA, and continuous improvement



Agile Collaboration & DevOps Leadership



Partner with developers, QA, and product teams in agile ceremonies

Champion DevOps best practices across teams

Mentor teams on pipelines, releases, and onboarding new services



What We’re Looking For

Required

5+ years in Azure-focused DevOps roles

Strong experience with Azure DevOps, YAML pipelines, and CI/CD automation

Proven expertise in Bicep, Terraform, or ARM templates

Deep hands-on knowledge of Azure PaaS and AKS

Solid understanding of cloud networking (DNS, load balancing, VPNs, firewalls)

Scripting skills in PowerShell, Bash, or Python

Strong grasp of secure DevOps practices



Nice to Have



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience

Azure certifications (AZ-400 preferred)

Docker, Kubernetes, Helm experience

Strong observability mindset (metrics, tracing, centralized logging)



Why Join L’EVATE & Our FINTECH Partner



Fully remote role with a high-performing Canadian FINTECH team

Work on modern, real-world financial systems, not legacy cleanup

Career growth in cloud, automation, and security at scale

Collaborative, engineering-first culture that values quality and ownership

title: Billing/AR Specialist
description:
Billing/AR Specialist - Ally Logistics



ABOUT ALLY LOGISTICS:

Ally Logistics is a U.S.-based third-party logistics (3PL) company headquartered in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Since 2012, we’ve been committed to creating the ultimate freight shipping experience by operating at the optimal intersection of people and technology. As a full-service 3PL, we specialize in a wide range of freight solutions, including dry van, refrigerated, drayage, straight truck, open deck/flatbed, drop-trailer programs, warehousing, and more. Our diverse service capabilities allow us to support shippers across industries with flexible, reliable, and scalable logistics strategies.

We partner with skilled global talent to support our continued growth and operational excellence, ensuring our customers receive efficient, high-quality service at every step of the supply chain.





ROLE SUMMARY:

The Billing/AR Specialist is responsible for accurate execution of billing, collections, and cash application tasks, as well as timely resolution of exceptions, to ensure financial operations run smoothly. The role includes processing customer invoices in accordance with customer requirements, verifying carrier payment information, applying customer payments accurately, and resolving payment issues promptly with both internal and external teams. The position requires strong attention to detail, effective problem-solving skills, and meticulous exception management.



Regular Weekly Schedule (40 hours): Monday – Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Standard Time with 1-hour unpaid lunch break from 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Eastern. Overtime (40+ hours) requires manager approval.



JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: 

-Process carrier paperwork and billing via Triumphpay/Revenova; ensuring accuracy and compliance with customer requirements 

-Apply customer payments accurately

-Timely resolution of unidentified payments and customer payment discrepancies

-Responsible for on-time payment collection from assigned customers



COMPENSATION:

Compensation will be determined based on experience. All payments are issued in USD via Wise.



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

-Minimum of 2 years of experience in logistics/3PL industry

-Minimum of 2 years of Billing/AR experience, preferably within the logistics/3PL industry

-Strong written and verbal English communication skills

-Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

-Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

-High attention to detail and accuracy

-Exceptional organizational and time management skills

-Headset

-Professional remote workspace

-Ability to work U.S. business hours (EST)



Experience with:

-Outlook

-Zoom phone

-Slack

-Basic CRM or logistics platform



Additional Requirements

1. Technology & Equipment Requirements

-Reliable high-speed internet and computer

-Webcam + microphone for Zoom calls

-Quiet, professional workspace



2. Availability Requirements

-Ability to work U.S. Eastern Time

, etc.)

title: Junior Spot Market Pricing & Bidding Analyst
description:
Junior Spot Market Pricing & Bidding Analyst  - Ally Logistics



ABOUT ALLY LOGISTICS:

Ally Logistics is a U.S.-based third-party logistics (3PL) company headquartered in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Since 2012, we’ve been committed to creating the ultimate freight shipping experience by operating at the optimal intersection of people and technology. As a full-service 3PL, we specialize in a wide range of freight solutions, including dry van, refrigerated, drayage, straight truck, open deck/flatbed, drop-trailer programs, warehousing, and more. Our diverse service capabilities allow us to support shippers across industries with flexible, reliable, and scalable logistics strategies.

We partner with skilled global talent to support our continued growth and operational excellence, ensuring our customers receive efficient, high-quality service at every step of the supply chain.



ROLE SUMMARY:

The Junior Spot Market Pricing & Bidding Analyst supports real-time spot market bidding and freight quoting across load boards, applying established pricing experience to execute competitive, market-informed bids. This role is designed for an experienced pricing professional who is still developing deeper lane ownership and independent bid strategy in a fast-paced spot market environment.



Regular Weekly Schedule (40 hours): Monday – Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Standard Time with 1-hour unpaid lunch break from 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Eastern. Overtime (40+ hours) requires manager approval.



JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: 

-Execute spot freight quoting and bidding across load boards using approved pricing strategies

-Monitor live market conditions, capacity trends, and carrier bid activity to adjust pricing in real time

-Analyze historical lane data and recent spot performance to inform pricing decisions

-Track bid outcomes, win/loss ratios, and pricing effectiveness by lane or customer

-Partner with operations and account teams to align pricing with execution realities

-Maintain pricing accuracy, responsiveness, and consistency in high-volume spot environments



KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)

-Win Rate

--% of spot bids won

--Shows if pricing is competitive



-Speed to Quote

--Time to submit a spot quote

--Speed matters most in spot bidding



-Margin

--Margin achieved vs target or market

--Confirms we’re not over- or under-pricing



-Re-Pricing Rate

--% of loads that need price changes after award

--Measures pricing accuracy



COMPENSATION:

Compensation will be determined based on experience. All payments are issued in USD via Wise.



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

-4+ years of experience pricing and quoting freight, with a strong focus on spot market execution

-Hands-on experience bidding freight on load boards.

-Solid understanding of U.S. spot market dynamics, lane volatility, and capacity cycles

-Proven ability to quote freight quickly while balancing competitiveness and margin

-Strong working knowledge of Excel, pricing tools, or TMS platforms

-Preferred qualification: Experience supporting high-volume or time-sensitive spot freight

-Preferred qualification: Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Business, or a related field

-Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

-High attention to detail and accuracy

-Exceptional organizational and time management skills 



Access to:

-A reliable computer with  high-speed internet

--Backup internet source (mobile hotspot or secondary line preferred)

-Webcam + microphone for Zoom calls

-Headset

-Professional remote workspace

-Ability to work U.S. business hours (EST)



Experience with:

-Outlook

title: UGC Project Coordinator
description:
Hi there! Our advertising agency is seeking a highly organized, proactive, and communicative UGC Project Coordinator to join our performance marketing agency that specializes in paid social media advertising for e-commerce brands. 



As a UGC Project Coordinator, your mission is to ensure content projects stay on schedule, creators are well-briefed, and communication remains seamless from initial outreach to final asset delivery. 



[About You]

What you have:

Must-have: Exceptional written English with the ability to adapt tone (from professional to "influencer-friendly").

Must-have: Organization; Mastery of project management software and spreadsheets.

UGC Knowledge: A solid understanding of what makes a high-performing UGC video (hooks, transitions, organic feel).

Influencer and Affiliate Marketing Knowledge: Experience with casting creators and managing campaigns and assets

Problem Solving: Ability to handle "no-shows" or shipping delays with grace and quick pivots.

Experience: Previous experience in Influencer Marketing or Social Media Coordination is highly preferred.

Nice to have: Whitelisting and Meta Business Ad knowledge





[About The Role]

This is a full-time role with 37.5 hours per week available. Time will be tracked in our project management system, ClickUp, and wages will be paid out monthly.

Hours: 8 AM-4 PM EST. 



The successful candidate will be responsible for:



1. Creator Outreach & Onboarding

Identify and vet potential UGC creators based on brand aesthetics and target demographics.

Manage initial outreach campaigns via
, Instagram DM, or TikTok.

Onboard new creators by sending contracts, brand guidelines, and product shipping information.



2. Project Coordination

Maintain the Content Calendar to ensure all deadlines for filming and posting are met.

Track product shipments and verify that creators have received items before filming starts.

Ensure all creators follow the provided Creative Briefs (hooks, CTAs, lighting requirements).



3. Communication Management

Act as the main point of contact for all creator inquiries.

Send friendly reminders for upcoming deadlines or overdue content.

Provide constructive feedback from the internal team to creators for any necessary revisions.



4. Asset Management & Reporting

Collect raw and edited files, ensuring they are organized in Google Drive or Dropbox.

Update project management tools (ClickUP) in real-time.

Basic auditing of content to ensure it meets technical specs (ratio, resolution, no watermarks).



[How to Apply]

To apply, please send your resume and portfolio to 
 with the subject line “APPLICATION: "UGC Project Coordinator"



If shortlisted, we’ll follow up to schedule a video meeting.

title: Executive Assistant / Outreach Specialist
description:
Blakely Brown is seeking a dedicated and professional individual to join our team as an Executive Assistant/Outreach Specialist. This role is pivotal in ensuring smooth and efficient communication with our clients from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM EST and managing complex scheduling requirements and other admin tasks.



If you're are passionate about data and EXCITED TO BRING ENERGY to work every day, then you're perfect for the team! We're looking for someone who's HARDWORKING with A GREAT PERSONALITY to join our team! If you have excellent communication skills and a genuine enthusiasm as a Virtual Assistant, this is the opportunity for you. Impress the owners with your passion, and wow us during the interview!



Position: Executive Assistant/Outreach Specialist

Location: Remote (Must be available during Eastern Standard Time - EST)

Type: Full-Time



Key Responsibilities:



- Outreach Campaigns: Coordinating with the team to successfully launch outreach campaigns and handling responses.

- Calendar Management: Efficiently manage and organize the executive's calendar, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.

- Client Communication: Serve as the first point of contact for clients, handling correspondence and communications with professionalism and discretion.

- Administrative Support: Provide comprehensive administrative support to the executive team, including document preparation, managing
s, and coordinating events.

- Project Coordination: Assist with project management tasks, ensuring deadlines are met and stakeholders are informed of progress.

- Confidentiality: Maintain the highest level of confidentiality and discretion with sensitive company and client information.



Requirements:



- Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or similar administrative support role.

- Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate directly with clients and tea
mbers.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and virtual meeting platforms (Zoom, Google Meet).

- Ability to work independently and in a remote setting, available during Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours.

- A proactive approach to problem-solving and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.



Benefits:



- Competitive salary with 13th Month Pay (500 GBP starting rate)

- 12 paid vacation leave per year and some public holidays in the Philippines are observed

- Opportunities for professional growth and development.

- Supportive and collaborative work environment.





How to Apply:



Please send your resume (PDF format: CV_Full Name) to 
 (remove the spaces between before and after 
 with the subject line: Executive Assistant - followed by an adjective that describes you.



KEEP IN MIND... "Following instructions is the most basic, yet essential, step toward achieving success." :-)



We look forward to hearing from you!
