title: STREETWEAR/GRAFFITI/TYPO/WHATEVER WE SAY ARTIST
description:
Senior Multi-Disciplinary Brand & Design Architect



Direct Engagement | High-Discretion Role | Sophisticated Global Brand Environment



Position Overview



We are seeking an exceptionally advanced, culturally fluent, and execution-driven Brand & Design Architect to work directly with us on the ongoing design, evolution, and protection of our brand ecosystem.



This is not a freelance marketplace role and not a single-style designer position. You will operate as a trusted, embedded creative partner, working closely with ownership and leadership across luxury, streetwear, heritage, consumer, digital, and physical brand environments.



This role requires mastery of multiple visual languages, strategic thinking, elite execution, and an uncompromising standard of professionalism, discretion, and reliability.



We determine whether or not your work is on par and could then be published.



?



Nature of Engagement

 • You will work directly with us, not through intermediaries

 • You must be able to align with our working hours, timelines, and pace

 • High availability, responsiveness, and follow-through are expected

 • This role involves access to confidential brand strategy, unreleased designs, and proprietary materials

 • Absolute discretion and confidentiality are mandatory



This position is designed for designers who understand trust, long-term alignment, and high-stakes creative environments.



?



Core Responsibilities

 1. Brand Architecture & Visual Governance

 • Design, evolve, and protect cohesive brand systems across all touchpoints

 • Maintain visual consistency while enabling controlled stylistic range

 • Translate strategic direction into precise, repeatable execution

 2. Multi-Style Design Mastery

 • Confidently design across:

 • Luxury and elevated minimalism

 • Streetwear and cultural counterpoints

 • Heritage and archival-inspired systems

 • Mass-culture consumer branding

 • Experimental and future-forward aesthetics

 • Every stylistic decision must be intentional, justified, and controlled

 3. Product, Apparel & Drop-Based Design

 • Design graphics, typography, layouts, and treatments for apparel and products

 • Support limited drops, campaigns, and long-term collections

 • Design with real-world production, materials, and scalability in mind

 4. Digital & Physical Brand Execution

 • Create assets for websites, apps, social, campaigns, and motion environments

 • Extend brand language into retail, pop-ups, packaging, signage, and physical spaces

 • Ensure digital and physical expressions feel unified and deliberate

 5. Cultural Intelligence & Strategic Relevance

 • Maintain deep awareness of global fashion, art, music, and urban culture

 • Apply trends selectively and strategically, never impulsively

 • Prioritize longevity, credibility, and brand equity over short-term hype

 6. Collaboration & Professional Discipline

 • Work closely with leadership, marketing, production, and strategy teams

 • Present work clearly, confidently, and with rationale

 • Iterate efficiently without sacrificing quality or intent



?



Required Qualifications

 • Proven experience designing across multiple brand tiers and aesthetics

 • Advanced proficiency in professional design tools (Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.)

 • Strong command of typography, layout systems, color theory, and composition

 • Experience delivering both digital and physical outputs

 • Ability to operate independently with minimal oversight

 • Exceptional attention to detail and execution quality

 • Strong communication skills and professional maturity



?



Portfolio Submission Requirements (Mandatory)



Applicants must submit a serious, well-curated portfolio demonstrating:

 • Clear range and versatility across distinct visual styles

 • Strategic thinking, including context and reasoning behind decisions

 • End-to-end execution, from concept through final output

 • Clear indication of your role and ownership in each project



Applications without a strong portfolio will not be considered.



?



Services & Capabilities Expected



You may be required to deliver:

 • Brand identity systems and visual guidelines

 • Apparel and product design assets

 • Campaign and launch visuals

 • Web and app design components

 • Retail and environmental branding

 • Packaging and physical collateral

 • Ongoing creative direction and visual oversight



?



Confidentiality, IP & Professional Standards

 • You must be extremely discreet regarding all work, communications, and materials

 • No work produced for us may be shared, published, reused, or referenced without explicit written permission

 • NDA, IP ownership, and confidentiality agreements will be required prior to engagement

 • This role demands absolute trust, discretion, and professionalism



?



Ideal Candidate



You are disciplined, culturally fluent, and strategically minded.

You understand that great design is not decoration — it is control, intention, and execution.

You are comfortable operating at a high level, under confidentiality, with long-term brand responsibility.



Exact Art & Design Styles Required (Non-Exhaustive)



The designer must demonstrate working mastery of the following specific, recognized art and design styles, with the ability to apply them appropriately across apparel, branding, digital, and physical environments:

 • Swiss / International Typographic Style

Grid-based systems, asymmetric layouts, objective typography, precision hierarchy, and clarity-driven composition.

 • Bauhaus & Modernist Design

Functional minimalism, geometric forms, primary color logic, and design driven by purpose rather than decoration.

 • Postmodern & Deconstructivist Design

Intentional rule-breaking, layered systems, visual tension, expressive typography, and controlled chaos.

 • Brutalist Graphic Design

Raw layouts, stark typography, high contrast, utilitarian structures, and anti-polish aesthetics.

 • Editorial & High-Fashion Art Direction

Magazine-driven composition, art-directed photography, typographic narrative, and visual pacing.

 • Luxury Minimalism

Extreme restraint, typographic refinement, tonal palettes, spacing discipline, and material sensitivity.

 • Streetwear & Underground Graphics

Poster culture, DIY aesthetics, cultural symbolism, stencil logic, graffiti-adjacent systems, and raw graphic expression.

 • Heritage / Archival Revival

Vintage typography, historical print methods, retro layouts, brand archaeology, and legacy reinterpretation.

 • Pop Art & Commercial Iconography

Bold color, repetition, simplified forms, mass-culture visual language, and instant recognizability.

 • Psychedelic & Experimental Graphics

Distorted typography, optical play, organic forms, layered visuals, and sensory-driven composition.

 • Futurist / Neo-Futurist Design

Motion-forward thinking, modular systems, technological aesthetics, and speculative visual language.

 • Minimalist Typography-First Systems

Type-led identity, hierarchy dominance, spacing control, and editorial logic over illustration.

 • Grunge & Raw Texture Design

Distress, imperfection, analog artifacts, and deliberate erosion of polish.

 • Conceptual & Art-Driven Design

Idea-first visuals, symbolism, reduction, and meaning embedded in form.

 • Campaign-Driven Visual Systems

Seasonal narratives, drop-based art direction, evolving visual arcs, and controlled variation.



?



Application Requirement



Applicants must clearly label which of the above styles are represented in their portfolio and demonstrate intentional, professional execution of each. Superficial or trend-based interpretations will not be considered.





PS:



YOU WILL NEED TO SHOW US VARIOUS WORK ALONG WITH VARIOUS STYLES TO THEN REPRESENT THAT WORK

YOU WILL NEED TO HANDLE MULTIPLE TASKS

YOU WILL NEED TO PREPARE THE WORKS YOU DO FOR US IN A WAY THAT IS IN A WAY WITH WHAT WE DO NOW

YOU WILL NEED TO SHOW US MORE THAN SIMPLE WORKS IE CANVA, SKETCHES, BROCHURES, BASIC ADS DO NOT JUST ATTACH THESE



DESIGNS LIKE

SUPREME

BAPE

KITH

STUSSY

ALD

RED BULL

ARIZONA

LAYS

WARREN LOTAS

VERDY 

VANDY THE PINK

HELLS PARADISE

DOROHEDORO

GACHIAKUTA

CHOWDER

FLAPJACK

ED EDD AND EDDY

HEY ARNOLD

SPIDERMAN

SUPERMAN

MASCOTS

INDI WORKS

CYBERPUNK

CYBER SIGILISM



PLEASE BE SURE TO INCLUDE SOFTWARES AND OTHER ART PRODUCTS YOU USE IE FIGMA, BLENDER, ADOBE, 

PLEASE BE SURE TO SAY IF YOU DONT DO ANY DIGITAL AND JUST RENDER 

PLEASE BE SURE TO MENTION TO US WHAT IT IS YOU DO 



BE COMFORTABLE WITH ON GOING PROJECTS, REVISIONS, GROUP WORKING, SOLO WORKING, NOTION, GOOGLE DRIVE AND OTHER APPLICATIONS THAT WOULD ALLOW US TO WORK TOGETHER EITHER SOLO OR AS A COLLECTIVE TEAM, WE'VE GOT TEAMS IN ALMOST ALL TIME ZONES SO PLEASE BE AWARE AND RESPECT THAT.



PROJECTS COULD BE A SIMPLE TYPO TO A FULL STORYBOARD, A MINI OUTLINE TO FULL WALL ILLUSTRATIONS



UPON SEEING YOUR WORK BASED ON PROJECTS FULL TIME WILL BE AN OPTION.



THANKS FOR APPLYING.

description:

Website:

About Us

Zion Trading Algos is a cutting-edge trading software company specializing in fully automated trading algorithms for NinjaTrader 8. Our algorithms help retail futures traders optimize their trading strategies, improve consistency, and automate their trading decisions.



We're looking for a motivated and results-driven Appointment Setter to help us generate sales calls with qualified prospects—retail traders who are struggling to trade profitably and are open to automation.



Your Role

MUST WRITE EXCELLENT ENGLISH

MUST SPEAK EXCELLENT ENGLISH



As our Appointment Setter, your job will be to identify, engage, and schedule calls with ideal prospects for our trading software. You’ll be reaching out via
, LinkedIn,
, and other platforms to connect with futures traders, NinjaTrader users, and retail traders looking for automation.



Key Responsibilities

Prospect & Qualify Leads: Identify and connect with traders who match our ideal customer profile.

Outreach & Engagement: Reach out via
,
, or other methods to introduce our trading software and gauge interest.

Book Sales Calls: Schedule qualified sales calls for the founder (who will handle the closing).

Follow Up: Ensure reminders are sent to reduce no-shows and maximize conversion rates.

Who We're Looking For

Experience in appointment setting, lead generation, or sales (trading/finance experience is a plus).

Strong written communication skills—you'll be engaging with traders online.

Self-motivated & results-driven—we want someone who takes initiative.

Familiarity with trading, NinjaTrader, or futures markets is a plus but not required.

Compensation & Growth Opportunity

Long-Term Potential: If successful, this could turn into a recurring role with higher pay and bonuses based on performance.

How to Apply

If you’re interested, send a message with:



Your experience with appointment setting or lead generation.

Any experience in trading, finance, or automation (not required but a plus).

Your approach to finding and engaging potential leads.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
Triforce Digital Marketing, a leading digital marketing agency specializing in innovative and results-driven strategies, is seeking a talented and experienced SEO Specialist to join our dynamic team. If you have a deep understanding of search engine optimization techniques, a proven track record of driving organic traffic and improving search rankings, and a passion for staying ahead of industry trends, we want to hear from you!



Responsibilities:



Conduct comprehensive keyword research and analysis to identify opportunities for organic traffic growth.

Develop and implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to improve search rankings and increase organic visibility.

Optimize website content, meta tags, headings, and other on-page elements for improved search engine relevance.

Perform technical SEO audits to identify and address any website performance and crawling issues.

Monitor and analyze website analytics and performance metrics to identify areas of improvement and track SEO campaign success.

Stay up-to-date with the latest SEO trends, algorithm updates, and best practices.

Collaborate with content creators, web developers, and designers to ensure SEO optimization throughout all digital assets.

Provide SEO recommendations and guidance to clients, communicating complex concepts in a clear and concise manner.

Track and report on SEO performance metrics, providing regular updates to clients and internal stakeholders.



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with local SEO, international SEO, or e-commerce SEO

Familiarity with content management systems, such as WordPress

Experience with A/B testing and conversion rate optimization

Solid understanding of on-page and off-page SEO optimization techniques.

Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex SEO concepts to clients and internal teams.

Detail-oriented and organized, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

A passion for staying up-to-date with the latest SEO trends and industry developments.



If you are excited about the opportunity to contribute to a forward-thinking digital marketing agency, we would love to hear from you! To be considered, use this link to send your application: 
/
/f/a
/VRLFUF5TDAZNPI1QXJ

title: Guest Experience and Software Development Specialist
description:
BurgBnB and Gulf Siesta is seeking a candidate with a bachelors in Computer Science/Computer Engineering with excellent communication and leadership skills with a minimum C1 level of English proficiency for a hybrid guest experience/software development role for a fast growing short-term rental company based out of the United States. Role will start out with 10 hours per week during training and after a few months hours will expand based on needs of the business eventually becoming a full time role. The candidate will work directly with the owner to optimize the guest experience for 14 rentals across two states. The candidate will interact with guests and optimize digital processes to create an optimal guest ecosystem. Candidate will help owner optimize rental listings across sales channels such as AirBnB, VRBO, 
, Expedia and their two direct book websites. Candidate will be responsible for managing two websites and optimizing website speed and SEO. In the future candidate will be responsible for launching paid advertising on Google and Meta marketing channels. Company has a robust tech stack and technical projects will be assigned that will require a bachelors in Computer Science/Computer Engineering. Seeking someone with a technical background that wants to leverage their diverse skill set in a guest-facing role that is a combination of customer service, marketing, and software development. Open to newly graduated Computer Science/Computer Engineering candidates if they are the right fit. Opportunity for significant growth in hours and salary based on the value added to the business. Seeking strong leadership skills and someone who wants to grow in the role. The right candidate could find themselves managing the entire business and other VA's in the far future.

title: Technical SEO & Domain Migration Lead
description:
(SaaS / Financial Services)

Location: Remote

Type: Contract (6–12 months, potential long-term)



Required Screening Questions

(Please answer all — incomplete responses will not be reviewed.)



1. Describe a domain migration you personally led.

2. How do you ensure link equity is preserved during a rebrand?

3. What are the 5 most common SEO mistakes that cause traffic loss during migration?

4. How would you monitor migration health during the first 30 days?

5. Explain how YMYL affects SEO strategy for financial services websites.

6. What tools would you use for this migration, and why?

7. 



All roles will collaborate during weekly migration sync meetings. Clear communication and documentation are required. Experience working in regulated or financial environments is strongly preferred.



My company is a business credit infrastructure platform and commercial data furnisher transitioning from a legacy brand into a SaaS-based financial services platform. We operate in a high-trust financial category and require a precise, risk-controlled SEO migration.



Role Overview



We are seeking a highly experienced Technical SEO specialist to lead our full domain migration and technical transition from our old website on Shopify to a new website customer built with Next.js



This role is responsible for protecting search equity, preserving organic rankings, and ensuring a seamless migration with minimal traffic loss.



This is not a junior SEO role. Migration experience is required.



Key Responsibilities

Pre-Migration



Full crawl and URL inventory of legacy domain



Backlink audit and link equity preservation strategy



Build detailed page-to-page 301 redirect map



Benchmark organic traffic and keyword rankings



Analyze anchor text profile



Prepare sitemap and robots.txt transition strategy



Migration Execution



Deploy 301 redirects (no blanket redirects)



Validate canonical tags and structured data



Configure Google Search Console property



Monitor crawl errors and indexation



Manage Core Web Vitals and performance issues



Post-Migration (First 60 Days)



Monitor ranking volatility



Identify and fix redirect chains



Repair broken internal links



Track index coverage and soft 404 errors



Weekly migration performance reporting



Required Experience



4+ years Technical SEO



Proven domain migration case studies



Experience in financial services, fintech, or SaaS



Strong knowledge of Google’s YMYL standards



Advanced proficiency with:



Google Analytics (GA4)



Google Search Console



Ahrefs or SEMrush



Screaming Frog



Success Metrics



Preserve 85–95% of legacy organic traffic



Maintain top-ranking URLs post-migration



Clean indexation with minimal errors



Stable domain authority transfer



Application Requirement



Submit a brief outline explaining how you would migrate a financial services website without losing link equity or traffic.



Final Question (Required)



Why do SEO migrations fail, and what differentiates a successful one?

title: DEVOPS / Infrastructure Engineer (Remote)
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking an experienced Infrastructure Engineer with specialized knowledge in Adobe Commerce (formerly Magento) to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable infrastructure solutions tailored to support Adobe Commerce environments. This role requires deep expertise in cloud technologies, infrastructure automation, and a strong understanding of Adobe Commerce architecture.





Duties and Responsibilities:

- Design, deploy, and maintain Adobe Commerce infrastructure on cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).

- Implement infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or Ansible to automate provisioning and configuration management.

- Optimize Adobe Commerce performance and ensure high availability through fault-tolerant design and continuous monitoring.

- Collaborate closely with development teams to understand application requirements and optimize infrastructure accordingly.

- Manage containerized applications using Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.

- Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate software delivery and deployment processes.

- Ensure security best practices are followed throughout the infrastructure, including data encryption, access controls, and vulnerability management.

- Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure Adobe Commerce applications meet SLAs and performance targets.

- Conduct regular infrastructure audits and capacity planning to anticipate future needs and scale infrastructure accordingly.

- Document infrastructure configurations, procedures, and policies.



Prerequisite Skills and Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field; or equivalent work experience.

- Proven experience as an Infrastructure Engineer or similar role with a focus on Adobe Commerce (Magento).

- In-depth knowledge of Adobe Commerce architecture, including cloud deployment models (Cloud, Commerce, B2B Commerce).

- Strong proficiency in cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.

- Hands-on experience with infrastructure automation tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, or Ansible.

- Familiarity with containerization technologies and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).

- Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.

- Solid understanding of networking concepts and protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP/S).

- Ability to troubleshoot complex issues related to infrastructure, performance, and scalability.

- Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

- Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect or similar are a plus.



Preferred Additional Skills:

- Experience with other eCommerce platforms and systems integration.

- Knowledge of relational and SQL databases commonly used with Adobe Commerce.

- Familiarity with Agile methodologies and project management tools.



Benefits:

- Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.

- Comprehensive health benefits package.

- Opportunities for professional development and certification reimbursement.

- Flexible work hours and remote work options.



Application Process:

Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter outlining their Adobe Commerce infrastructure experience, along with any relevant certifications. We look forward to reviewing your application and discussing how you can contribute to our team’s success.

Implement FAQ schema opportunities

Authority Building (Post-Migration)



Develop pillar content strategy around:



Business Credit Reporting



Data Furnishing



Commercial Credit Monitoring

Success Metrics

Increase organic conversion rate

Application Requirement

Final Question (Required)

title: Acquisitions Closer – Real Estate
description:
Acquisitions Closer – Real Estate 



Are you process-driven, direct, and energized by real conversations?

We’re looking for a disciplined outbound sales professional based in the Philippines to connect with property owners facing urgent, complex situations—delinquent taxes, inherited estates, title issues, and more. Our sellers aren’t just “leads”—they’re people in transition who need straight answers and real solutions.



This is not a basic call center job.

If you’re skilled at asking the right questions, unafraid of hearing “no,” and want your compensation to reflect your results—not just your effort—read on.



Role Overview:



Primary focus: Outbound calling to distressed property owners—cold calls, follow-ups, and active pipeline management.



Objective: Uncover seller motivation, determine property fit, and guide owners to a clear outcome (offers or next steps).



Daily routine: High phone activity, rapid qualification, disciplined follow-up, accurate notes.



Pace: High volume, high accountability. Activity and results are tracked and reviewed.



Compensation Structure:



Base pay: Modest, for reliability.



Commission: Significant; your earnings scale with your results.



No ceiling: Top performers set their own income.



Underperformance: Addressed quickly—excuses are not accepted.



Environment & Expectations:



You control your own pipeline—but are measured daily.



Calls are monitored, results are tracked, and feedback is regular.



If you thrive in a disciplined, no-excuses culture, you’ll succeed here.



If you require micro-management or dislike structure and direct feedback, this will not be a fit.



What We’re Looking For:



Resilience: Can you keep dialing and qualifying, no matter how many rejections?



Clarity: Can you speak directly, ask difficult questions, and move conversations toward a decision?



Self-management: Do you measure your own output and seek improvement—without constant reminders?



Motivation: Are you truly driven by the opportunity to control your income?



Application Instructions – Read Carefully



Voice Recording (Required):

Send a 2–3 minute audio introduction (not read, not AI-generated).

Cover these points, in this order:



Your name and most relevant phone sales experience.



Why you’re a strong fit for conversations with distressed sellers (not just generic sales).



How you organize your workday to maintain consistent output, even when wins are delayed.



What excites you about commission-based earnings.



How you handle feedback and respond to strict accountability.



Applications missing the recording, or not following the format above, will not be considered.

Attach your resume as well.
